messages: [{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-06 12:45:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-02-06 13:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-06 13:22:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-02-06 15:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 12:45:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix triggers for release-approval pipeline

The release-approval pipeline implemented a nice infinite loop as
it was triggered by all comment-added events, and Zuul is posting one
every time the job runs.

Add a regexp to exclude comment-added events from the 'zuul' user.

Also since patchset-created actually does not trigger comment-added,
it needs to be specified separately (in order to approve releases
proposed by the PTL themselves).

Change-Id: I0f8b8526adaa83876ff92a98500d35c70cc23174
"}]
commit_message:
Fix triggers for release-approval pipeline

The release-approval pipeline implemented a nice infinite loop as
it was triggered by all comment-added events, and Zuul is posting one
every time the job runs.

Add a regexp to exclude comment-added events from the 'zuul' user.

Also since patchset-created actually does not trigger comment-added,
it needs to be specified separately (in order to approve releases
proposed by the PTL themselves).

Change-Id: I0f8b8526adaa83876ff92a98500d35c70cc23174

[{'created': '2020-01-31 10:14:56.000000000', 'message': 'Re execute a test case if fixtures.TimeoutException is thrown

Since [1] was introduced, it's very frequent to have
"fixtures._fixtures.timeout.TimeoutException" exceptions during the
execution of UTs and FTs. Because the privsep includes the synchronized
decorator, the synchronization wait is done inside the privsep context.
This is prone to timeouts if the wait is too long.

Until we can reorder the decorators of ip_lib [2] or we can remove the
sync decorators [3], this patch can mitigate the errors in the CI.

Backporting for stable/stein as mentioned change [1] is in this branch

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/631275/
[2]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666853/
[3]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657608/

Closes-Bug: #1843478

Change-Id: If865c4683645f9bd11f5e1b528bade0547505bfd
(cherry picked from commit 63715ea361ea94fb48842c83deef1e5850bcc44d)
'}]
commit_message:
Re execute a test case if fixtures.TimeoutException is thrown

Since [1] was introduced, it's very frequent to have
"fixtures._fixtures.timeout.TimeoutException" exceptions during the
execution of UTs and FTs. Because the privsep includes the synchronized
decorator, the synchronization wait is done inside the privsep context.
This is prone to timeouts if the wait is too long.

Until we can reorder the decorators of ip_lib [2] or we can remove the
sync decorators [3], this patch can mitigate the errors in the CI.

Backporting for stable/stein as mentioned change [1] is in this branch

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/631275/
[2]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666853/
[3]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657608/

Closes-Bug: #1843478

Change-Id: If865c4683645f9bd11f5e1b528bade0547505bfd
(cherry picked from commit 63715ea361ea94fb48842c83deef1e5850bcc44d)

commit_message:
nova-libvirt: add UEFI packages to support UEFI instances

Fix inability to run UEFI-based images/instances by installing UEFI
packages also in nova-libvirt image which is not based on nova-base.

Adapted for Stein and below (e.g. Rocky) by removing
any C8 support.

Closes-Bug: #1814552
Co-authored-by: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>
Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1d5cd3d9af98444acac5bedd7daeaa6c6673dcd6
(cherry picked from commit 15b68c15c1dd0c2df1cc49b550f2fa03a4c65e8e)
(cherry picked from commit ffaf585d0f05ccd9123459bb0cdf345af5b09573)

commit_message:
Fix qemu loading of ceph.conf (permission error)

ceph.conf is loaded by qemu, not libvirt.
Since qemu runs as the nova user, ceph.conf owned by root
causes a permission error. The logs in
/var/log/libvirt/qemu/instance-*.log reveal the error.

This change fixes the issue by changing the ownership of ceph.conf
in nova-libvirt to the nova user.

Adapted for Stein and below by amending paths (no cells).

Closes-Bug: #1861513
Change-Id: I1881f51a6c8508f0f186a5623443343dc1df41d4
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>
(cherry picked from commit 91910d2a455f66e5f014a04bedf132fe0cab55ea)
(cherry picked from commit e2c600d9a1317422acd95f460f726201f84d4187)

commit_message:
Fix qemu loading of ceph.conf (permission error)

ceph.conf is loaded by qemu, not libvirt.
Since qemu runs as the nova user, ceph.conf owned by root
causes a permission error. The logs in
/var/log/libvirt/qemu/instance-*.log reveal the error.

This change fixes the issue by changing the ownership of ceph.conf
in nova-libvirt to the nova user.

Adapted for Stein and below by amending paths (no cells).

Closes-Bug: #1861513
Change-Id: I1881f51a6c8508f0f186a5623443343dc1df41d4
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>
(cherry picked from commit 91910d2a455f66e5f014a04bedf132fe0cab55ea)
(cherry picked from commit e2c600d9a1317422acd95f460f726201f84d4187)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-05 13:31:29.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Make Ubuntu jobs voting"

We need to set Ubuntu jobs to non-voting again since Tempest has stopped working with python2 now that some modules are not installed. I think the issue should be solved by just porting Tempest (when installed from source) to use python3.

This reverts commit edd7558ee2ab23539cd14da2e66293a6d24f5885.

Change-Id: I21b4128176372fdfb33f2ef6028d2bf0c59e709a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Make Ubuntu jobs voting"

We need to set Ubuntu jobs to non-voting again since Tempest has stopped working with python2 now that some modules are not installed. I think the issue should be solved by just porting Tempest (when installed from source) to use python3.

This reverts commit edd7558ee2ab23539cd14da2e66293a6d24f5885.

Change-Id: I21b4128176372fdfb33f2ef6028d2bf0c59e709a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-04 17:38:00.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid calling neutron for N networks

In the worst case scenario, we could list N floating IPs, each of which
has a different network. This would result in N additional calls to
neutron - one for each of the networks. Avoid this by calling neutron
once for all networks associated with the floating IPs.

Change-Id: If067a730b0fcbe3f59f4472b00c690cc43be4b3b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid calling neutron for N networks

In the worst case scenario, we could list N floating IPs, each of which
has a different network. This would result in N additional calls to
neutron - one for each of the networks. Avoid this by calling neutron
once for all networks associated with the floating IPs.

Change-Id: If067a730b0fcbe3f59f4472b00c690cc43be4b3b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Build failed.

- pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered finger://d0fe4b8af32b/e79a7fb196b847fa95eb5262cb891c57 : RETRY_LIMIT in 7s'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2020-02-05 09:59:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

Thanks for review Andrey!

 > This opinionated minus due to two questions:
 > 
 > 1. Do you consider to make a cleanup during attachment process
 > itself?
 > It can be confusing for further code readers that errors of
 > one API call are fixed in another one (attach and detach).

The problem is, attaching the volume is an asynchronous operation, which means it involves a cast from api to compute. Unless we block in the api waiting when compute completes the attachment we simply have no way to identify the problem. Or do you mean allow user to attach that same volume again if it was reserved by the same instance?

 > 2. What are chances of that happened. I mean when MQ flaps a lot of
 > things can go wrong. Do you think it is possible to fix it with
 > cinder client?

From cinder POV, something reserved the volume. Unless we do the attachment in one request, without doing reservation separately, I don't think it can be done in cinderclient."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2020-02-05 10:43:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fix volume attachment rollback

If messaging connection between compute and conductor flaps,
it is possible that wrap_instance_event decorator might fail.
In case of volume attachment process, if that decorator fails
to call object_class_action_versions of indirection api, the
volume will stay in the reserved state without cleaning up,
even when instance is deleted.

This change adds cleanup of such cases in the detach_volume
compute manager method, so that the user is able to put
their volume back in the usable state. As volume attachment
and detachment use the lock by instance.uuid, detachment
will not be happening in the middle of attachment. If detach
happens before attachment finishes, attachment will fail
with 404 attachment not found when nova will try to set
connection info in the cinder attachment object.

Closes-Bug: 1860107
Change-Id: I11556c6f3e921fd6f4dce513728bdfad12f2d7b1

Download Magnum images once

We delegate the post-installation steps to localhost, but we do not
limit to running them once so we download them multiple times :(

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 10:00:03.000000000', 'message': "Bump tox minversion to 3.9 due to inline comments

Current minimal required version of tox (3.4.0),
as per tox.ini, is not compatible with inline comments.

Support for inline comments in deps was added in 3.9 according to:
- https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-deps
- https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html#v3-9-0-2019-04-17

E.g. there are inline comments at deps lines:

  [testenv:molecule]
  deps =
      ansible
      ansi2html  # GPL (soft-dependency of pytest-html)

which then fails like:

  ERROR: Invalid requirement: 'ansi2html  # GPL (soft-dependency of pytest-html)'

Change-Id: Ic1a3457a8164097b73dd906744c49171aa4cb833
"}]
commit_message:
Bump tox minversion to 3.9 due to inline comments

Current minimal required version of tox (3.4.0),
as per tox.ini, is not compatible with inline comments.

Support for inline comments in deps was added in 3.9 according to:
- https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-deps
- https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html#v3-9-0-2019-04-17

E.g. there are inline comments at deps lines:

  [testenv:molecule]
  deps =
      ansible
      ansi2html  # GPL (soft-dependency of pytest-html)

which then fails like:

  ERROR: Invalid requirement: 'ansi2html  # GPL (soft-dependency of pytest-html)'

Change-Id: Ic1a3457a8164097b73dd906744c49171aa4cb833

commit_message:
nova: Release 19.1.0

Minor version bump due to the change in API behvaiour introduced by
I0322d872bdff68936033a6f5a54e8296a6fb3434 / 4a691c33d1.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 19.0.3..HEAD
d8fbf04f32 Mask the token used to allow access to consoles
8346c527b3 FUP for in-place numa rebuild
4a691c33d1 Disable NUMATopologyFilter on rebuild
9f57d16f38 Block rebuild when NUMA topology changed
d41afc7276 Remove 'test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails' test
23d3b8fbc9 Remove global state from the FakeDriver
6310e69303 libvirt: check job status for VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_MIGRATED event
2f48bbd224 libvirt: remove conditional on VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_POSTCOPY
99aa8ebc12 Zuul v3: use devstack-plugin-nfs-tempest-full
95bf4a1e15 block_device: Copy original volume_type when missing for snapshot based volumes
9f9f8d330a Do not update root_device_name during guest config
fec95a2e4f Improve metadata server performance with large security groups
99048af872 Cache security group driver
e858ab3bbe compute: Use long_rpc_timeout in reserve_block_device_name
ad873b67b3 [stable-only] Disable cinder-backup service in nova-next job
92eb45ba5e Replace time.sleep(10) with service forced_down in tests
304d3f62a4 compute: Take an instance.uuid lock when rebooting
603171bd5c Join migration_context and flavor in Migration.instance
a0290858b7 Block deleting compute services with in-progress migrations
9983b24624 Add functional recreate revert resize test for bug 1852610
7d67387246 Add functional recreate test for bug 1852610
b18e42d20b Add functional recreate test for bug 1829479 and bug 1817833
65ada9745c Use admin neutron client to see if instance has qos ports
b1ae940ddb Use admin neutron client to query ports for binding
87f7a4268f Add BFV wrinkle to TestNovaManagePlacementHealAllocations
92645be4bb Add --instance option to heal_allocations
4acec3e715 Add --dry-run option to heal_allocations CLI
e00fa24a18 Don't delete compute node, when deleting service other than nova-compute
f2d6dbd771 Revert "openstack server create" to "nova boot" in nova docs
a80eb82f67 Remove redundant call to get/create default security group
844209b064 Add regression test for bug 1824435
06caa62441 Add integration testing for heal_allocations
defe542eb1 Nova compute: add in log exception to help debug failures
13d01b697d Imported Translations from Zanata
8ee59604dc Avoid error 500 on shelve task_state race
972d717984 Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset
6272046bc8 Added openssh-client into bindep
022ea28194 libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration
6038455e1d Fix listing deleted servers with a marker
47caaccd4a Add functional regression test for bug 1849409
792ec7c1df Fix unit of hw_rng:rate_period
c0313bce06 Fix exception translation when creating volume
a06922d546 Stop sending bad values from libosinfo to libvirt
530ad1ae88 Error out interrupted builds
e4a5516098 Functional reproduce for bug 1833581
080b4759d3 Prevent init_host test to interfere with other tests
c565cab479 Add functional test for resize crash compute restart revert
53bcf0b1ee Handle get_host_availability_zone error during reschedule
58ad6aba98 Ignore sqla-migrate inspect.getargspec deprecation warnings on py36
7e074ad030 rt: soften warning case in _remove_deleted_instances_allocations

Change-Id: I0eab7f690dd8f44f2c30df6fba5fca625406acff

I'm not familiar with the process (schedule and the version number, e.g. why 20.1.0 comes after 20.0.1), but otherwise there are lots of changes (see end of my comment), so it looks OK to me. Anything worth to wait from the open changes maybe? https://review.opendev.org/#/q/project:openstack/nova+branch:stable/train+status:open

[ Unreleased changes in openstack/nova (stable/train) ]

Changes between 20.0.1 and 27bfd0bc62

* 27bfd0bc62 2019-12-29 13:59:43 +0000 libvirt: check job status for VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_MIGRATED event
* 48bb9a9663 2019-12-20 12:09:04 +0000 FUP for in-place numa rebuild
* 94c0362918 2019-12-19 16:47:04 +0000 Disable NUMATopologyFilter on rebuild
* 745de99063 2019-12-19 16:46:53 +0000 Block rebuild when NUMA topology changed
* 8b766d14cf 2019-09-23 14:41:03 +0100 Remove 'test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails' test
* e82e1704ca 2019-12-18 19:21:08 +0100 Zuul v3: use devstack-plugin-nfs-tempest-full
* 3ea6a7f79b 2019-12-05 14:02:54 +0000 Cache security group driver
* d7826bcd76 2019-11-29 11:40:44 +0000 Mask the token used to allow access to consoles
| * c64a136ea7 2019-12-12 15:43:22 +0000 Revert "docs: Highlight the current broken state of SEV" (partially)
| * 7bdd8e97fb 2019-12-12 15:19:00 +0000 Create a controller for qga when SEV is used
| * 0662697bbf 2019-12-12 15:18:53 +0000 Also enable iommu for virtio controllers and video in libvirt
| * f38e151b0d 2019-12-12 15:18:43 +0000 Switch to uses_virtio to enable iommu driver for AMD SEV
| * 5e858d0cbd 2019-11-27 16:06:21 +0000 Do not update root_device_name during guest config
|/
| * 059dc01ae0 2019-11-29 11:30:43 +0000 block_device: Copy original volume_type when missing for snapshot based volumes
|/
| * 939cd9b177 2019-11-26 18:14:10 +0000 compute: Take an instance.uuid lock when rebooting
| * f9a1bc7105 2019-12-02 20:09:55 +0000 compute: Use long_rpc_timeout in reserve_block_device_name
| * f3763778dd 2019-11-26 13:42:08 +0000 Reset instance to current vm_state if rolling back in resize_instance
* a5daa0ddb3 2019-11-26 13:58:13 +0000 Replace time.sleep(10) with service forced_down in tests
* e2b4e3346e 2019-11-14 22:06:53 +0000 Join migration_context and flavor in Migration.instance
| * 98757fa7e7 2019-10-29 07:02:24 +0000 Added openssh-client into bindep
| * 418af2d865 2019-11-14 22:07:37 +0000 Improve metadata server performance with large security groups
|/
| * a9650b3cbf 2019-11-15 09:16:16 -0500 Block deleting compute services with in-progress migrations
| * 3774952410 2019-11-15 08:57:03 -0500 Add functional recreate revert resize test for bug 1852610
| * 28d76cc7ae 2019-11-15 08:52:56 -0500 Add functional recreate test for bug 1852610
|/
| * 716cde5454 2019-11-20 13:37:19 +0000 Don't delete compute node, when deleting service other than nova-compute
| | * 0d2c26c087 2019-11-19 06:43:07 +0000 Imported Translations from Zanata
| |/
| * 4cb493fe4f 2019-11-13 13:40:59 +0100 Use admin neutron client to see if instance has qos ports
| * c7a43d3427 2019-11-13 09:10:13 +0000 Use admin neutron client to gather port resource requests
| * b6989836dd 2019-11-13 09:06:04 +0000 Use admin neutron client to query ports for binding
|/
* 47e5e89cea 2019-11-06 19:46:48 +0000 Revert "openstack server create" to "nova boot" in nova docs
* 35b5dc0d97 2019-11-02 20:53:31 +0000 Nova compute: add in log exception to help debug failures'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-02-03 13:39:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I'm not familiar with the process (schedule and the version number,
 > e.g. why 20.1.0 comes after 20.0.1), 

We tend to bump the minor version (with 20.1.0 mapping to a major version 20, minor version 1, release version 0) when we change or fix API behaviour such as this. A previous example of this would be I346b1c2d170fb5e78692f62734317eac54d9a123 that introduced 18.2.0 a while ago when I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761 landed in stable/rocky.

 > but otherwise there are lots of changes (see end of my comment), 
 > so it looks OK to me. Anything worth to wait from the open changes maybe? 
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/q/project:openstack/nova+branch:stable/train+status:open

Nothing jumped out at me but I can post to the ML before to ACK this.

 > [ Unreleased changes in openstack/nova (stable/train) ]
 > 
 > Changes between 20.0.1 and 27bfd0bc62
 
FWIW this is also in the commit message itself."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-02-03 13:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

PTL ack'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-02-03 14:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-05 09:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-02-05 17:02:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-05 21:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-06 12:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
nova: Release 20.1.0

Minor version bump due to the change in API behvaiour introduced by
I0322d872bdff68936033a6f5a54e8296a6fb3434 / 94c0362918.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 20.0.1..HEAD
27bfd0bc62 libvirt: check job status for VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_MIGRATED event
48bb9a9663 FUP for in-place numa rebuild
94c0362918 Disable NUMATopologyFilter on rebuild
745de99063 Block rebuild when NUMA topology changed
8b766d14cf Remove 'test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails' test
e82e1704ca Zuul v3: use devstack-plugin-nfs-tempest-full
c64a136ea7 Revert "docs: Highlight the current broken state of SEV" (partially)
7bdd8e97fb Create a controller for qga when SEV is used
0662697bbf Also enable iommu for virtio controllers and video in libvirt
f38e151b0d Switch to uses_virtio to enable iommu driver for AMD SEV
3ea6a7f79b Cache security group driver
f9a1bc7105 compute: Use long_rpc_timeout in reserve_block_device_name
d7826bcd76 Mask the token used to allow access to consoles
059dc01ae0 block_device: Copy original volume_type when missing for snapshot based volumes
5e858d0cbd Do not update root_device_name during guest config
939cd9b177 compute: Take an instance.uuid lock when rebooting
a5daa0ddb3 Replace time.sleep(10) with service forced_down in tests
f3763778dd Reset instance to current vm_state if rolling back in resize_instance
716cde5454 Don't delete compute node, when deleting service other than nova-compute
0d2c26c087 Imported Translations from Zanata
a9650b3cbf Block deleting compute services with in-progress migrations
3774952410 Add functional recreate revert resize test for bug 1852610
28d76cc7ae Add functional recreate test for bug 1852610
418af2d865 Improve metadata server performance with large security groups
e2b4e3346e Join migration_context and flavor in Migration.instance
4cb493fe4f Use admin neutron client to see if instance has qos ports
c7a43d3427 Use admin neutron client to gather port resource requests
b6989836dd Use admin neutron client to query ports for binding
47e5e89cea Revert "openstack server create" to "nova boot" in nova docs
35b5dc0d97 Nova compute: add in log exception to help debug failures
98757fa7e7 Added openssh-client into bindep

Change-Id: I35b1531b7716671305daf451432514995857a954

"}, {'created': '2020-01-22 02:27:26.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

Masakari is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

'}]
commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Masakari is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Co-authored-by: Ghanshyam <gmann@ghanshyammann.com>
Change-Id: If7ba4697a2e5e7f6390187e094a1e7f3c1996078

commit_message:
Remove old CNI handlers

Seems like AddHandler and DelHandler are not used by kuryr-daemon or CNI
code anymore and this commit gets rid of them.

Change-Id: I28f4a1b7d6b683d81970bf6a4cfb3fe6d95dfb90

commit_message:
Adds policy in code to Tap-as-a-Service

Adding oslo.policy allows operators to use and customize RBAC for tap-as-a-service instead of
relying on Neutron's default policy.

Change-Id: I6132054ef3bd8423990f91fae6329dfd089660b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 07:45:32.000000000', 'message': "[os_tempest] set venv to python3 for stackviz

Currently on CentOS7 system, python2 is used by default but
stackviz is installed in venv and pulls upstream constrients and
upstream is removing support of py2 and leading to failure of
dependencies.

Since python3 is available in CentOS7, let's use that for stackviz
purpose.

Change-Id: I8871799516cc192508b3ce3d3d93c255d8591bef
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[os_tempest] set venv to python3 for stackviz

Currently on CentOS7 system, python2 is used by default but
stackviz is installed in venv and pulls upstream constrients and
upstream is removing support of py2 and leading to failure of
dependencies.

Since python3 is available in CentOS7, let's use that for stackviz
purpose.

Change-Id: I8871799516cc192508b3ce3d3d93c255d8591bef
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

Add charm-interface-keystone-notifications project

This patch adds charm-interface-keytone-notifications project to enable
the use of identity-notifications relation in reactive charms.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/703691

messages: [{'account_id': 30687, 'date': '2020-02-06 08:13:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-02-06 08:26:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nodd we did not backport to rocky...'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-02-06 09:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-02-06 10:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 08:13:15.000000000', 'message': 'Remove /etc/hosts entries pointing hostname to localhost and prevent
cloud-init to manage /etc/hosts

1) Ubuntu includes a line in /etc/hosts that makes the local hostname and
nodename (if different) point to 127.0.1.1. This can break RabbitMQ,
which expects the hostname to resolve to the API network address.

2) The distribution might come with cloud-init installed, and manage_etc_hosts
configuration enabled. If so, it will override the file /etc/hosts from cloud-init
templates at every boot, which will break RabbitMQ.

This change fixes these issues.

Change-Id: I53261d0403b983ab419bd44e705b89f7b7a1c316
Closes-Bug: #1837699
(cherry picked from commit 0b24a0f2f0880c35368581e3acc529672da665f8)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove /etc/hosts entries pointing hostname to localhost and prevent
cloud-init to manage /etc/hosts

1) Ubuntu includes a line in /etc/hosts that makes the local hostname and
nodename (if different) point to 127.0.1.1. This can break RabbitMQ,
which expects the hostname to resolve to the API network address.

2) The distribution might come with cloud-init installed, and manage_etc_hosts
configuration enabled. If so, it will override the file /etc/hosts from cloud-init
templates at every boot, which will break RabbitMQ.

This change fixes these issues.

Change-Id: I53261d0403b983ab419bd44e705b89f7b7a1c316
Closes-Bug: #1837699
(cherry picked from commit 0b24a0f2f0880c35368581e3acc529672da665f8)

commit_message:
Make groups documentation part dynamic

The groups.yaml file is now the source of information concerning the
validations groups. The groups information part is now created
dynamically by reading the groups.yaml file.

This patch also fixes the basepython conflict for the tox py37 testenv.

Change-Id: Id199fc250afa0646b1e851581e3a92290f7bcb00
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add configuration option influxdb.batch_size

The new configuration option is used to control the maximum size of
batches written to InfluxDB and optimizes performance for high loads.
The default value is set to 10 000 data points per batch.

Change-Id: I82c3e4e64984a996e41fe2657ce36b032b40d3fd
Story: 2007191
Task: 38319

[{'created': '2020-01-31 06:37:59.000000000', 'message': "Test artifact publishing via AFS

I'm requesting this job be temporarily merged for testing publishing
artifacts to an AFS volume instead of pushing it to a static server.
This is part of the efforts to retire our static.openstack.org server
and serve files from our distributed storage [1].

Because the publishing steps happen in the post phase using a secret
value in project-config to get the kerberos ticket for writing to AFS,
we have to commit changes to really test them.

This repository is a good user of the artifact upload process and a
good target for testing the changes on just one repository.

This adds a job ironic-python-agent-build-image-tinyipa-publish-to-afs
which is ultimately parented to the new
publish-openstack-artifacts-with-afs from project-config.  The only
difference is that this will upload the output to AFS, where I will
check that everything copied as expected.  We can then revert this.

Ultimately we will change the publish-openstack-artifacts job in
project-config -- this will be transparent to end-users such as this
repository as we will be switching tarballs.openstack.org to use this
at the same time.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/705159
[1] https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/infra-specs/latest/specs/retire-static.html

Change-Id: Ib2ae8c2d9f59695ce7af5414f73e1f4bcc7ae462
"}]
commit_message:
Test artifact publishing via AFS

I'm requesting this job be temporarily merged for testing publishing
artifacts to an AFS volume instead of pushing it to a static server.
This is part of the efforts to retire our static.openstack.org server
and serve files from our distributed storage [1].

Because the publishing steps happen in the post phase using a secret
value in project-config to get the kerberos ticket for writing to AFS,
we have to commit changes to really test them.

This repository is a good user of the artifact upload process and a
good target for testing the changes on just one repository.

This adds a job ironic-python-agent-build-image-tinyipa-publish-to-afs
which is ultimately parented to the new
publish-openstack-artifacts-with-afs from project-config.  The only
difference is that this will upload the output to AFS, where I will
check that everything copied as expected.  We can then revert this.

Ultimately we will change the publish-openstack-artifacts job in
project-config -- this will be transparent to end-users such as this
repository as we will be switching tarballs.openstack.org to use this
at the same time.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/705159
[1] https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/infra-specs/latest/specs/retire-static.html

Change-Id: Ib2ae8c2d9f59695ce7af5414f73e1f4bcc7ae462

commit_message:
Remove handling legacy monasca-agent service file

monasca-agent service file is not used anymore. monasca-collector,
monasca-forwarder and monasca-statsd are new services defined in
monasca-agent target.

This change removes the legacy monasca-agent service file handling from
DevStack plugin.

Story: 2000975
Task: 36886

Change-Id: Iac7d608a202440381f211d04b0978218ac36c54d

commit_message:
Fix batch_size configuration option in Docker

The configuration option name for Kafka batch size (max. number of
messages before commiting them to Kafka broker) has been changed in
Queens release. The option passed to Docker image must reflect that.

Change-Id: Ib720c4d0358a5e67734fbc38d9a7d513e662d65f
Story: 2007225
Task: 38492

[{'created': '2020-02-04 16:52:13.000000000', 'message': "Handle neutron without the fip-port-details extension

The 'fip-port-details' API extension was added to neutron in Rocky [1]
and is optional. As a result, we cannot rely on the 'port_details' field
being present in API responses. If it is not, we need to make a second
query for all ports and build 'port_details' using the 'port_id' field.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron-lib/rocky.html#relnotes-1-14-0-stable-rocky-new-features

Change-Id: Ifb96f31f471cc0a25c1dfce2161a669b97a384ae
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1861876
"}, {'created': '2020-02-04 17:38:00.000000000', 'message': "Handle neutron without the fip-port-details extension

The 'fip-port-details' API extension was added to neutron in Rocky [1]
and is optional. As a result, we cannot rely on the 'port_details' field

Change-Id: Ifb96f31f471cc0a25c1dfce2161a669b97a384ae
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1861876
"}]
commit_message:
Handle neutron without the fip-port-details extension

The 'fip-port-details' API extension was added to neutron in Rocky [1]
and is optional. As a result, we cannot rely on the 'port_details' field
being present in API responses. If it is not, we need to make a second
query for all ports and build 'port_details' using the 'port_id' field.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron-lib/rocky.html#relnotes-1-14-0-stable-rocky-new-features

Change-Id: Ifb96f31f471cc0a25c1dfce2161a669b97a384ae
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1861876

[{'created': '2020-02-04 05:10:22.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore SR-IOV VFs on dhcp_all_interfaces list

When os-net-config fails, it will trigger the configure_safe_defaults
function, which will enable dhcp on all interfaces which has link up
and having a valid mac address. SR-IOV VFs will also fall in this
list, ignore VFs in the dhcp all list.
Closes-Bug: #1861473

Change-Id: I563f42dc417ce5e403310ea33b969e19d16ad68f
(cherry picked from commit bc014864282372e74839aefd6d7a444a20643af3)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore SR-IOV VFs on dhcp_all_interfaces list

When os-net-config fails, it will trigger the configure_safe_defaults
function, which will enable dhcp on all interfaces which has link up
and having a valid mac address. SR-IOV VFs will also fall in this
list, ignore VFs in the dhcp all list.
Closes-Bug: #1861473

Change-Id: I563f42dc417ce5e403310ea33b969e19d16ad68f
(cherry picked from commit bc014864282372e74839aefd6d7a444a20643af3)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 12393, 'name': 'chandan kumar', 'display_name': 'Chandan Kumar', 'email': 'chkumar@redhat.com', 'username': 'chkumar246'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 29755, 'name': 'wesgerrit hayutin', 'email': 'wesgerrithayutin@gmail.com'}]

[{'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-02-04 13:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-02-04 14:08:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Many oslo libraries will remove py27 support - like the rest of OpenStack.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012330.html

And see other repos like nova that have stopped py27 support already.

I'm not sure whether this is the right approach at all but leave that to requirements team to decide.

-1 for inline comment, this will not work as is."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-02-04 14:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

yeah, I will not suggest to cap the requirement which can end up doing for many lib. its time to drop the py2 aggressivly. Same I mentioned in ML- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012356.html'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-02-04 16:13:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> yeah, I will not suggest to cap the requirement which can end up
 > doing for many lib. its time to drop the py2 aggressivly. Same I
 > mentioned in ML- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012356.html

Thanks @gmann @andreas for the comments, I am not sure how to move forward but by looking at uc we have some many dependencies are capped with py27 conditions'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-02-04 16:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > yeah, I will not suggest to cap the requirement which can end up
 > > doing for many lib. its time to drop the py2 aggressivly. Same I
 > > mentioned in ML- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012356.html
 > 
 > Thanks @gmann @andreas for the comments, I am not sure how to move
 > forward but by looking at uc we have some many dependencies are
 > capped with py27 conditions

Yeah we did for few dependencies but now oslo and QA tooling droppping py2 so many/almost all projects still running py2 jobs will start failing. 

Next week is the deadline to complete the py2 drop work so projects failing on py2 jobs has to drop the py2 on priority. Tempest gate is also blocked due to that and we are on fixing it by dropping py2 jobs.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-02-04 16:46:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

This would expand testing needed by projects still supporting python2.  As the py2 and py3 versions diverge over time I don't see this being maintainable, even over the next month or two.

If this were to be allowed it'd require a change in global-requirements to keep the cap on py27"}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-02-05 06:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks everyone for the comments, addressed here https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:1861803+(status:open+OR+status:merged) abandoning it'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-02-05 06:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-02-06 09:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}]

[{'created': '2020-02-04 13:59:33.000000000', 'message': 'Keep oslo.concurrency to 3.31.0 for py2.7

TripleO jobs still runs on CentOS7 but new oslo.concurrency
4.0.0 breaks the py27 jobs. Pinning to a working version for
the same fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1861803

Change-Id: I3f2ead92cf8ff27b7c65aca952ec49eda3070173
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Keep oslo.concurrency to 3.31.0 for py2.7

TripleO jobs still runs on CentOS7 but new oslo.concurrency
4.0.0 breaks the py27 jobs. Pinning to a working version for
the same fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1861803

Change-Id: I3f2ead92cf8ff27b7c65aca952ec49eda3070173
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove stray conditional from aodh-evaluator tasks

In Ib4c59302ad5ad64f23419cd69ee9b2a80333924e a conditional
was moved incorrectly and left as a stray. Luckily it is
only a cosmetic issue, but it might be confusing when doing
any maintenance work so it's better to remove it.

Change-Id: Iac3cbf23437bb11ec47dd1a0f189babe0c5587d0
(cherry picked from commit edd10576ca33337b09070da204a88d189456a5e2)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary jobs from networking-spp

Python 2.7 support and tests were already dropped from networking-spp.
And openstack-python-jobs-neutron job contains openstack-tox-py27 job.
So this patch removes openstack-python-jobs-neutron job from
networking-spp.
Other tests contained in openstack-python-jobs-neutron are contained
in jobs which specified in networking-spp's zuul.yaml.

And, this patch also removes check-requirements job from
networking-spp.
check-requirements job is specified in networking-spp's zuul.yaml.

Change-Id: Idfc286489bdc9d89e2bae9316e31607fca244a54

subject: Remove /etc/hosts entries pointing hostname to localhost and prevent cloud-init to manage /etc/hosts
messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-27 08:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-09-27 12:01:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-09-27 12:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm facing this issue with MAAS deployed servers, and my current workaround is same with you, except I have 1 more step.

From Ubuntu 18.04 and above, /etc/hosts is managed via cloud-init if you use MAAS, and cloud-init will overwrite it at every boot, from /etc/cloud/templates/hosts.debian.tmpl. So this should be disabled too, if we can know whether the OS has been installed with MAAS or not.

MAAS puts a file to /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/90_dpkg_local_cloud_config.cfg, which includes "manage_etc_hosts: true". So we can do another replace if this file exists.

Another way can be overriding manage_etc_hosts if the OS has cloud-init installed. This will be a generic solution.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-27 12:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-09-29 09:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think Dincer is right, this only hides the problem initially. :-('}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-09-30 04:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-10-07 19:51:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-10-08 03:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-08 06:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-08 06:51:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-10-08 07:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-10-08 07:51:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (4 comments)

There might have a permission issue cause /etc/cloud may contain sensitive data. That's why I use become while checking whether cloud.cfg exists."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-10-08 08:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

> I'm facing this issue with MAAS deployed servers, and my current
 > workaround is same with you, except I have 1 more step.
 > 
 > From Ubuntu 18.04 and above, /etc/hosts is managed via cloud-init
 > if you use MAAS, and cloud-init will overwrite it at every boot,
 > from /etc/cloud/templates/hosts.debian.tmpl. So this should be
 > disabled too, if we can know whether the OS has been installed with
 > MAAS or not.
 > 
 > MAAS puts a file to /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/90_dpkg_local_cloud_config.cfg,
 > which includes "manage_etc_hosts: true". So we can do another
 > replace if this file exists.
 > 
 > Another way can be overriding manage_etc_hosts if the OS has
 > cloud-init installed. This will be a generic solution.

This comment suggests it is in a different file, and that it should be manage_etc_hosts rather than update_etc_hosts. cloud-init docs confirm it should be manage_etc_hosts: https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/modules.html#update-etc-hosts'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-10-09 06:15:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Mark, sorry for my missing details on my last commit.

Last night, I've tested cloud-init with centos 6/7, debian 9/10, and ubuntu 16/18 just to be sure about what I'm trying to fix. I'm not focusing on fixing this issue just on ubuntu, cause cloud-init is the root cause, and doesn't matter whether you deployed the os with a tool like maas or not. For a generic and distro independent fix there's 2 way.

1) Find whether manage_etc_hosts is configured or not with "grep -lr --exclude-dir=templates manage_etc_hosts /etc/cloud", replace the string if configured. We need to use grep because the configuration can be out of cloud.cfg.

2) We can disable the module update_etc_hosts[1] which uses manage_etc_hosts as a configuration key. The modules are loaded always in cloud.cfg, so we don't need to do a grep. Also, it doesn't matter whether if manage_etc_hosts is still there, cloud-init does not provide errors.

I need your thoughts to go on fixing this issue. When we agree on the same way, I'll send the patch asap.

[1] https://github.com/cloud-init/cloud-init/blob/master/cloudinit/config/cc_update_etc_hosts.py'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-10-09 08:15:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-10-09 08:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Mark, sorry for my missing details on my last commit.
 > 
 > Last night, I've tested cloud-init with centos 6/7, debian 9/10,
 > and ubuntu 16/18 just to be sure about what I'm trying to fix. I'm
 > not focusing on fixing this issue just on ubuntu, cause cloud-init
 > is the root cause, and doesn't matter whether you deployed the os
 > with a tool like maas or not. For a generic and distro independent
 > fix there's 2 way.
 > 
 > 1) Find whether manage_etc_hosts is configured or not with "grep
 > -lr --exclude-dir=templates manage_etc_hosts /etc/cloud", replace
 > the string if configured. We need to use grep because the
 > configuration can be out of cloud.cfg.
 > 
 > 2) We can disable the module update_etc_hosts[1] which uses
 > manage_etc_hosts as a configuration key. The modules are loaded
 > always in cloud.cfg, so we don't need to do a grep. Also, it
 > doesn't matter whether if manage_etc_hosts is still there,
 > cloud-init does not provide errors.
 > 
 > I need your thoughts to go on fixing this issue. When we agree on
 > the same way, I'll send the patch asap.
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/cloud-init/cloud-init/blob/master/cloudinit/config/cc_update_etc_hosts.py

Thanks for the explanation. I think the code just needs a comment to clarify what it is doing. I imagine (might be wrong) you could also override the list of modules via cloud.cfg.d, but this is probably not so common, and you could omit update_etc_hosts in that case.

Another alternative would be to add a cloud.cfg.d/99_kolla_manage_etc_hosts file which sets manage_etc_hosts to false.'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-10-09 19:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-10-10 12:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-10-10 13:21:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-10-10 15:47:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2019-10-11 04:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-11 16:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-10-14 05:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 2349364a210d5b97a442c0c0a3925fb7f820e42e'}, {'account_id': 30687, 'date': '2020-02-06 08:13:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 3ca1b012f1972c38f75e91ff8d99d4f6a0a974d9'}]

commit_message:
Remove /etc/hosts entries pointing hostname to localhost and prevent
cloud-init to manage /etc/hosts

1) Ubuntu includes a line in /etc/hosts that makes the local hostname and
nodename (if different) point to 127.0.1.1. This can break RabbitMQ,
which expects the hostname to resolve to the API network address.

2) The distribution might come with cloud-init installed, and manage_etc_hosts
configuration enabled. If so, it will override the file /etc/hosts from cloud-init
templates at every boot, which will break RabbitMQ.

This change fixes these issues.

Change-Id: I53261d0403b983ab419bd44e705b89f7b7a1c316
Closes-Bug: #1837699

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-28 08:12:16.000000000', 'message': "Drop legacy mappings, fixing Windows support

For backwards compatibility reasons, os-brick imports all the
connectors, exposing them by the class name.

The issue is that one of the connectors, the scaleio one, is
no longer importable on Windows. A recent patch is using ioctl
calls through the fcntl module, which isn't available on Windows.

There's a TODO for dropping those mappings. By doing this, we'll
no longer import unused connectors, restoring Windows support.

Change-Id: Ibec2b798e8c5c3457cebea12cfd2f5813e62fb9e
Closes-Bug: #1850109
"}, {'created': '2019-10-29 08:34:15.000000000', 'message': "Add platform check, fixing Windows support

For backwards compatibility reasons, os-brick imports all the
connectors, exposing them by the class name. Although there's a
TODO for removing those mappings in 2.x, Cinder is still using
them.

A recent patch is using ioctl calls through the fcntl module,
which isn't available on Windows, so the scaleio connector
can't be imported, essentially breaking Windows support.

As a quick fix, we'll add a platform check, skipping this import
on Windows.

Change-Id: Ibec2b798e8c5c3457cebea12cfd2f5813e62fb9e
Closes-Bug: #1850109
"}, {'created': '2019-10-29 10:52:40.000000000', 'message': "Add platform check, fixing Windows support

For backwards compatibility reasons, os-brick imports all the
connectors, exposing them by the class name. Although there's a
TODO for removing those mappings in 2.x, Cinder is still using
them.

A recent patch is using ioctl calls through the fcntl module,
which isn't available on Windows, so the scaleio connector
can't be imported, essentially breaking Windows support.

As a quick fix, we'll add a platform check, skipping this import
on Windows.

Change-Id: Ibec2b798e8c5c3457cebea12cfd2f5813e62fb9e
Closes-Bug: #1850109
"}, {'created': '2019-10-29 19:02:26.000000000', 'message': "Split connector list by platform

We'll keep separate lists of connectors for each of the supported
operating systems so that we don't end up trying to use unsupported
connectors.

Change-Id: Ibec2b798e8c5c3457cebea12cfd2f5813e62fb9e
Closes-Bug: #1850109
"}, {'created': '2019-10-30 07:35:49.000000000', 'message': "Split connector list by platform

We'll keep separate lists of connectors for each of the supported
operating systems so that we don't end up trying to use unsupported
connectors.

Since Cinder is explicitly trying to use the iSCSI/FC connectors,
we'll have to include those as well, for now.

Change-Id: Ibec2b798e8c5c3457cebea12cfd2f5813e62fb9e
Closes-Bug: #1850109
"}, {'created': '2019-11-12 10:22:09.000000000', 'message': "Split connector list by platform

Closes-Bug: #1850109
"}, {'created': '2019-11-12 11:20:26.000000000', 'message': "Split connector list by platform

We'll keep separate lists of connectors for each of the supported
operating systems so that we don't end up trying to use unsupported

Since Cinder is explicitly trying to use the iSCSI/FC connectors,

commit_message:
Split connector list by platform

We'll keep separate lists of connectors for each of the supported
operating systems so that we don't end up trying to use unsupported
connectors.

Since Cinder is explicitly trying to use the iSCSI/FC connectors,
we'll have to include those as well, for now.

Change-Id: Ibec2b798e8c5c3457cebea12cfd2f5813e62fb9e
Closes-Bug: #1850109

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Cleanup python 2.7 removal

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

This removes some cruft from Python 2.7 support.
Raise requests lower-constraint to satisfy oslo.config.

Change-Id: I47cc8ab5b348af28062ab3ff5329b96d2cbccdbb

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-31 17:59:07.000000000', 'message': 'Check "security_group_rule" quota during security group creation

The tracked resources quota check is done at the beginning of an API
call to the Neutron server. The API call contains a resource and an
action over the resource. In case of creation, the server checks if
the number of items requested fits in the existing quota.

In case of security group creation, the tracked resource checked is
"security_group". But "SecurityGroupDbMixin.create_security_group"
method also creates several default rules for the new group and the
quota for "security_group_rule" is not enforced.

This patch checks the number of security group rules being created
("delta") and checks in the plugin method (not in the API method) if
there is enough room for those new rules (tracked resource
"security_group_rule").

Change-Id: I0a9b91b09d6260ff96fdba2f0a455de53bbc1f00
Closes-Bug: #1858680
(cherry picked from commit 936bd67aa42b2e06241d309315b895c9c9c49dcc)
'}]
commit_message:
Check "security_group_rule" quota during security group creation

The tracked resources quota check is done at the beginning of an API
call to the Neutron server. The API call contains a resource and an
action over the resource. In case of creation, the server checks if
the number of items requested fits in the existing quota.

In case of security group creation, the tracked resource checked is
"security_group". But "SecurityGroupDbMixin.create_security_group"
method also creates several default rules for the new group and the
quota for "security_group_rule" is not enforced.

This patch checks the number of security group rules being created
("delta") and checks in the plugin method (not in the API method) if
there is enough room for those new rules (tracked resource
"security_group_rule").

Change-Id: I0a9b91b09d6260ff96fdba2f0a455de53bbc1f00
Closes-Bug: #1858680
(cherry picked from commit 936bd67aa42b2e06241d309315b895c9c9c49dcc)

With the addition of K2K-specific tests in the tempest plugin and a
config toggle in the plugin to disable use of the external IdP, we can
safely add a voting federation job. This also fixes the devstack plugin
to install the xmlsec1 tool which is needed for K2K.

Change-Id: I9dc634e073657ff337751ec67363a57bd10e20d4
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/689222
(cherry picked from commit fb0be8e59917b5b637926d9526a64676af07ebf0)

'}]
commit_message:
Add voting k2k tests

With the addition of K2K-specific tests in the tempest plugin and a
config toggle in the plugin to disable use of the external IdP, we can
safely add a voting federation job. This also fixes the devstack plugin
to install the xmlsec1 tool which is needed for K2K.

Change-Id: I9dc634e073657ff337751ec67363a57bd10e20d4
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/689222
(cherry picked from commit fb0be8e59917b5b637926d9526a64676af07ebf0)
(cherry picked from commit ac74320876ac6c771d69b85ebb30058fe4eb3692)

PowerMax Driver - RDF clean snapvx target fix

Added source volume to _sync_check to prevent device
id from being overwritten when attempting to clean up
snapvx target sessions only.

When os-net-config fails, it will trigger the configure_safe_defaults

and having a valid mac address. SR-IOV VFs will also fall in this

commit_message:
Ignore SR-IOV VFs on dhcp_all_interfaces list

When os-net-config fails, it will trigger the configure_safe_defaults
function, which will enable dhcp on all interfaces which has link up
and having a valid mac address. SR-IOV VFs will also fall in this
list, ignore VFs in the dhcp all list.
Closes-Bug: #1861473

Change-Id: I563f42dc417ce5e403310ea33b969e19d16ad68f
(cherry picked from commit bc014864282372e74839aefd6d7a444a20643af3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-05 12:02:29.000000000', 'message': "Remove side-car containers in Create status

The change Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323 added a mechanism
to remove side-car containers before spawning a new one for the same
network.

For dnsmasq side-car, it matches on container statuses Exited
and Created, while all remaining containers match on Exited only.
However if a node running side-car is shut down ungracefully, containers
end in Created status and wrapper script won't be able to start the
containers because they already exist.

This change goes only to Train because in current master (Ussuri) these
wrappers were replaced by ansible.

Closes-bug: #1862010

Change-Id: I7909cd18c7a123d64d24ebc33167d415a8cfb228
(cherry picked from commit 378580d3d8b3909c113e8d5c9bcae1fbf3315376)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove side-car containers in Create status

The change Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323 added a mechanism
to remove side-car containers before spawning a new one for the same
network.

For dnsmasq side-car, it matches on container statuses Exited
and Created, while all remaining containers match on Exited only.
However if a node running side-car is shut down ungracefully, containers
end in Created status and wrapper script won't be able to start the
containers because they already exist.

This change goes only to Train because in current master (Ussuri) these
wrappers were replaced by ansible.

Closes-bug: #1862010

Change-Id: I7909cd18c7a123d64d24ebc33167d415a8cfb228
(cherry picked from commit 378580d3d8b3909c113e8d5c9bcae1fbf3315376)

commit_message:
add centos8 highavailability,powertools

the pacemaker rpms are no longer supplied in delorean-deps,
they have moved to a centos-8 repo.

also add powertools on the advice of rdo team.

centos/8/HighAvailability/x86_64/os
centos/8/PowerTools/x86_64/os

Co-Authored-By: Rafael Folco <rfolco@redhat.com>

commit_message:
zuul: all functional jobs now depend on linter job first

There is no need to run functional jobs if the linters don't pass; often
due to syntax errors.
This patch will help to save CI resources when syntax isn't good in a
patch.

Change-Id: Ibc202e84108fb7f64906dc41cc14923bb113f9cd
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emacchi@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 585d0c177947b58228badce37b23fd6cb8b78389)

commit_message:
Fix all py27 tests

This change fixes our py27 tests. The issue was a cascading failure caused
by a bad mock for sys.stdout.flush which results in general failure when
calling system and other builtin functions.

Change-Id: Ia1a108e77dd50404b78d952c9c9a9c0d534a5d28
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6aa5cdd3b02eff76aea9cda9103b2b173339c717)

commit_message:
Add tripleo_role_networks to inventory role group vars

Both invertory host vars and deployment global vars set enabled_networks.
Host var is snake_case network, global var is CamelCase network.
Global var takes precedence as we explicly include it in the deployment
playbook.

Create tripleo_role_networks to avoid conflicts and drop the enabled_networks
host vars at it is not currently used (AFAICT).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705757/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705767/
Change-Id: I6108aebf49a4bbc98394987f56dce6bcbe521b3a
Related-bug: #1861296

messages:
[{'account_id': 29979, 'date': '2019-09-17 01:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2019-09-17 02:25:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed.

- pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered http://52.27.155.124/23/682523/1/check/pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered/b90f689/ : FAILURE in 27m 08s'}, {'account_id': 14473, 'date': '2019-09-17 02:28:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why is this being reverted? Are the directories being cleaned up in some other piece of code?'}, {'account_id': 29979, 'date': '2019-09-17 03:21:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Why is this being reverted? Are the directories being cleaned up in
 > some other piece of code?

When images_type is rbd, it doesn't mean shared storage. The previous patch create an empty directory and do nothing with it. So there is a directory left every time after cold migration."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-09-17 04:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/682523/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 27m 51s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-09-17 09:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-37478 : FAILURE in 1h 06m 50s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-06 21:43:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> When images_type is rbd, it doesn't mean shared storage.

I think that should be mentioned in the commit message since it's a common misconception with how the libvirt driver handles shared storage, i.e. that $instances_path could be local storage while the instance root disk image is stored in shared rbd.

This change could have weird unforeseen implications for code that assumes this method works properly. I know Lee Yarwood has some side effect issues because of this, probably most notable that ensure_libvirt_rbd_instance_dir_cleanup workaround config option. Would this make that option invalid now?

Either way I'd want lyarwood and mdbooth involved in this."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-11-07 10:51:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > > When images_type is rbd, it doesn't mean shared storage.
 > 
 > I think that should be mentioned in the commit message since it's a
 > common misconception with how the libvirt driver handles shared
 > storage, i.e. that $instances_path could be local storage while the
 > instance root disk image is stored in shared rbd.
 > 
 > This change could have weird unforeseen implications for code that
 > assumes this method works properly. I know Lee Yarwood has some
 > side effect issues because of this, probably most notable that
 > ensure_libvirt_rbd_instance_dir_cleanup workaround config option.
 > Would this make that option invalid now?
 > 
 > Either way I'd want lyarwood and mdbooth involved in this.

I don't think this change is going to have a direct impact on the ensure_libvirt_rbd_instance_dir_cleanup workaround. This code revert is limited to _is_storage_shared_with which is only used by migrate_disk_and_power_off that itself doesn't call cleanup where the workaround is actually found [1]. 

That said, during a revert resize we would end up reaching this workaround and it might actually result in a shared instance directory being removed if the workaround is enabled (as documented [2]). So I think we can replace the workaround with a call to _is_storage_shared_with if we go ahead with this revert.

We do really need to pay down the debt around shared instance path and block checks otherwise this is just getting way too confusing for anyone to understand. Matt didn't you have a refactor posted a while ago for this?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/f28839b523186121b6481e607321ddbff370cfc5/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L1412-L1420
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/f28839b523186121b6481e607321ddbff370cfc5/nova/conf/workarounds.py#L196-L224"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-11-07 11:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2019-11-07 11:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build SUCCESSFUL (check pipeline).

- pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered http://52.27.155.124/23/682523/2/check/pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered/6d4ac11/ : SUCCESS in 28m 21s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-11-07 12:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-38899 : FAILURE in 1h 26m 18s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-11-07 13:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/682523/2 : SUCCESS in 2h 26m 43s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-07 15:25:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Matt didn't you have a refactor posted a while ago for this?

I don't remember that off the top of my head.

The longer term solution for a long of this confusion is likely implementing support for shared storage providers with placement so that we can let the imagebackend deal with the shared or not aspect of the root disk storage and rely on placement shared storage aggregates to tell us if the local disk is on shared storage or not."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-07 15:26:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

*for a lot of this confusion'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-11-22 12:04:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2019-11-22 12:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Revert "nova shared storage: rbd is always shared storage"

This reverts commit 05b7f63a42e3512da6fe45d2e6639fb47ed8102b.

The _is_storage_shared_with method is specifically checking if the
instance directory is shared. It is not checking if the actual instance
disks are shared and as a result assumptions cannot be made based on the
value of images_type.

Closes-Bug: 1824858
Change-Id: I52293b6ce3e1ce77fa31b382d0067fb3bc68b21f

subject: Ignore SR-IOV VFs on dhcp_all_interfaces list
messages: [{'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-02-04 05:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-02-05 14:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-04 05:10:32.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore SR-IOV VFs on dhcp_all_interfaces list

When os-net-config fails, it will trigger the configure_safe_defaults
function, which will enable dhcp on all interfaces which has link up
and having a valid mac address. SR-IOV VFs will also fall in this
list, ignore VFs in the dhcp all list.
Closes-Bug: #1861473

Change-Id: I563f42dc417ce5e403310ea33b969e19d16ad68f
(cherry picked from commit bc014864282372e74839aefd6d7a444a20643af3)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore SR-IOV VFs on dhcp_all_interfaces list

When os-net-config fails, it will trigger the configure_safe_defaults
function, which will enable dhcp on all interfaces which has link up
and having a valid mac address. SR-IOV VFs will also fall in this
list, ignore VFs in the dhcp all list.
Closes-Bug: #1861473

Change-Id: I563f42dc417ce5e403310ea33b969e19d16ad68f
(cherry picked from commit bc014864282372e74839aefd6d7a444a20643af3)

[{'created': '2020-02-04 10:25:33.000000000', 'message': 'Swap tasks to avoid non-existing variable error.

The upgrade workflow to Stein has a guard task that
checks that the --limit option is being used when
running the overcloud upgrade run command, as the
upgrade needs to be performed node by node due to
the operating system upgrade. However, if the --limit
option is not passed, the upgrade tasks fails in the
task right before the guard, as that task already
references the undefined variable. So, it is needed
to invert the order so we fail at will in the guard

Change-Id: I9ffddcaa52314c615362969757c94ebdf01a3b6d

(cherry picked from commit bca35e611bbc8f103e4893282c9b2c49aa4e1e48)

commit_message:
Swap tasks to avoid non-existing variable error.

The upgrade workflow to Stein has a guard task that
checks that the --limit option is being used when
running the overcloud upgrade run command, as the
upgrade needs to be performed node by node due to
the operating system upgrade. However, if the --limit
option is not passed, the upgrade tasks fails in the
task right before the guard, as that task already
references the undefined variable. So, it is needed
to invert the order so we fail at will in the guard
task.

Change-Id: I9ffddcaa52314c615362969757c94ebdf01a3b6d
Closes-Bug: #1861663
(cherry picked from commit bca35e611bbc8f103e4893282c9b2c49aa4e1e48)

commit_message:
Ignore SR-IOV VFs on dhcp_all_interfaces list

When os-net-config fails, it will trigger the configure_safe_defaults
function, which will enable dhcp on all interfaces which has link up
and having a valid mac address. SR-IOV VFs will also fall in this
list, ignore VFs in the dhcp all list.
Closes-Bug: #1861473

Change-Id: I563f42dc417ce5e403310ea33b969e19d16ad68f
(cherry picked from commit bc014864282372e74839aefd6d7a444a20643af3)

commit_message:
Enable sudo rule creation

We need to enable creation of sudo rule creation for user under which sensubility
is executed to enable operators execution of any command they possibly need
in their health check implementation.

Change-Id: I47c6e4fb3beab14cc5c7f824646e3c2242b140d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-04 14:33:14.000000000', 'message': "Extend qos DriverBase with validate_rule_for_port()

The openvswitch qos driver supports the min-bw qos rule only on
networks backed by physnets. Currently the qos driver interface does
not have a method that takes both the policy/rule and the network/port,
therefore we don't have enough information in the driver to tell if
we support the min-bw rule for a port or not. This change introduces
validate_rule_for_port(..., rule, port) so we have all the information
to tell.

The base method validate_rule_for_port() is concrete, but does
nothing (i.e. returns None), therefore other qos drivers
do not need to override this method explicitly. Their behavior
remains the same without code change.

Change-Id: I58a47bb895bede219cfeebbf0665aaf01660ce89
Needed-By: I02d77a03c411dc8ab303a7d7b53d7ea93cc9f4c6

Change-Id: I58a47bb895bede219cfeebbf0665aaf01660ce89

commit_message:
Extend qos DriverBase with validate_rule_for_port()

The openvswitch qos driver supports the min-bw qos rule only on
networks backed by physnets. Currently the qos driver interface does
not have a method that takes both the policy/rule and the network/port,
therefore we don't have enough information in the driver to tell if
we support the min-bw rule for a port or not. This change introduces
validate_rule_for_port(..., rule, port) so we have all the information
to tell.

The base method validate_rule_for_port() is concrete and returns True
for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I58a47bb895bede219cfeebbf0665aaf01660ce89
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/705695
Partial-Bug: #1861442
Related-Bug: #1819029

commit_message:
Bump diskimage-builder to 2.30.0 in UC

Diskimage-builder (DIB) is a branch-less project. Unfortunately pip
made a change that required a modification to DIB[1]. This patch was
first released in DIB 2.30.0.
To fix image building on the OpenStack stable branches, we need to
bump diskimage-builder to 2.30.0 in the upper-constraints.txt of
the stable OpenStack releases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695823/

Change-Id: Iaed3883d1ab09d95c884c73e7281005a2ada0652

commit_message:
Remove six usage

This repo does not support Python 2 anymore, so we don't need
six for compatibility between Python2 and 3, convert six usage to Python
3 code.

Change-Id: I3edab6e67ac79d14fe9d38f6f75abfd50030fa1e

> We could make the temp_path something that defaults to "/tmp" by default and allows the caller (tripleoclient in most cases) to override?

"temp_file" is a means of passing information between tripleoclient and this playbook. Though we creating a temp file for the input of this variable, the variable itself has a meaning. It caries the file name (absolute path) where the horizon url should be provided as output from this playbook. I woul stilld recommend to rename "temp_file" (even in the other playbook), to depict the usage with respect to the playbook. 

Lets take the error case, when the input is not provided. The fail task's messsage would be "Input missing temp_file". Instead if the error is something like "Input missing - horizon_url_output_file", it is easy to do a search on tripleoclient to understand how it is all connected.

commit_message:
Add cli playbook to retrieve the horizon url

This playbook will retrieve the horizon url from a heat stack and store it in
a temp file which can be used within the tripleoclient when displaybin the
url data.

Change-Id: I85cb99d47cf3cb4f3093fc856e9f6892115ff5ef
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-01-28 17:48:10.000000000', 'message': "Add 'dataclasses'

The dataclasses library has been added to the standard library in Python
3.7 [1]. The minimum version of Python used in Ussuri is Python 3.6, but
a rolling backport package is available on PyPI. Add this.

- Is the library actively maintained?
  Yes. It is a rolling backport for Python 3.7 only maintained by the
  developer of this feature now found in the stdlib.
  See https://pypi.org/project/dataclasses/

- Is the library good code?
  Yes. It has since been merged to the Python stdlib.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  Yes. Only for Python 3.6.

- Is the library license compatible?
  Yes (Apache-2.0)

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
  (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
  No.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
  global-requirements.txt
  No.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup?
  Yes. We want to use this functionality in nova.

- Do I need to update anything else?
  No.

Change-Id: Ie4337fd7d2ed18b1f16a18102d7fb925e04144e3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add 'dataclasses'

The dataclasses library has been added to the standard library in Python
3.7 [1]. The minimum version of Python used in Ussuri is Python 3.6, but
a rolling backport package is available on PyPI. Add this.

- Is the library actively maintained?
  Yes. It is a rolling backport for Python 3.7 only maintained by the
  developer of this feature now found in the stdlib.
  See https://pypi.org/project/dataclasses/

- Is the library good code?
  Yes. It has since been merged to the Python stdlib.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  Yes. Only for Python 3.6.

- Is the library license compatible?
  Yes (Apache-2.0)

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
  (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
  No.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
  global-requirements.txt
  No.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup?
  Yes. We want to use this functionality in nova.

- Do I need to update anything else?
  No.

Change-Id: Ie4337fd7d2ed18b1f16a18102d7fb925e04144e3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-05 10:41:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix resources cleanup

When running "test_create_manage_and_write" test with
default share type (i.e. set default_share_type_name
= default in tempest.conf) it passed, however, when
there is no default share type it failed with
"Target share type is still in use."
This is because the failed managed share is not deleted
before the share type it is based on.
This patch makes sure the manila share is deleted before
its share type.

Change-Id: I1ba4ae3dcc274bf5e6dee5320e52117f440ebb5d
Related-bug: #1862001
'}]
commit_message:
Fix resources cleanup

When running "test_create_manage_and_write" test with
default share type (i.e. set default_share_type_name
= default in tempest.conf) it passed, however, when
there is no default share type it failed with
"Target share type is still in use."
This is because the failed managed share is not deleted
before the share type it is based on.
This patch makes sure the manila share is deleted before
its share type.

Change-Id: I1ba4ae3dcc274bf5e6dee5320e52117f440ebb5d
Related-bug: #1862001

commit_message:
[Queens-only] Remove extra $ from KEYSTONE_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD variable.

This allows it to actually be evaluated/rendered.

Change-Id: Ifa98821f145a229dde5c070e122819aa68b7a8dd
Closes-Bug: #1861248
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-09 16:18:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix boot_roles in InstanceSystemMetadata

The "value" attribute of the InstanceSystemMetadata SQL table is a String
of length 255 currently, which is not long enough to contain a list of
roles ("boot_roles") which can easily exceed 255 characters when you have
a Rapid RBAC user who has multiple roles (17 roles in the case of the
sample Rapid RBAC group that we have defined). "boot_roles" is part of the
system-generated metadata belonging to each server instance created.

The solution is to break the role list into multiple metadata items in
the database. When the role list is retrieved by the user/vendor, the role
list is reconstructed.

Co-Authored-By: CLIFF PARSONS <cliff.parsons@att.com>

Change-Id: I057b46c4af384fd0836cd973a5998fe3bcb56175

commit_message:
Fix boot_roles in InstanceSystemMetadata

The "value" attribute of the InstanceSystemMetadata SQL table is a String
of length 255 currently, which is not long enough to contain a list of
roles ("boot_roles") which can easily exceed 255 characters when you have
a Rapid RBAC user who has multiple roles (17 roles in the case of the
sample Rapid RBAC group that we have defined). "boot_roles" is part of the
system-generated metadata belonging to each server instance created.

The solution is to break the role list into multiple metadata items in
the database. When the role list is retrieved by the user/vendor, the role
list is reconstructed.

Co-Authored-By: CLIFF PARSONS <cliff.parsons@att.com>
Closes-Bug: 1855749
Change-Id: I057b46c4af384fd0836cd973a5998fe3bcb56175

commit_message:
Switch from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme

That's what the OpenStack community is using today. Also with newer
Sphinx versions, the current approach does no longer build.

Change-Id: Iab9f72bb146e8dd36de7fa868b41801e0c97e2ea

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Unisphere storage group/array tagging support

This feature allows the user to tag a storage group and/or an
array in Unisphere with a user defined tag, to facilitate easy
access and classification.

Change-Id: Ifaf66360a604df55be8c0c197de6d9f1bf3cc9f6
Implements: blueprint powermax-storage-group-tagging

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-12 13:29:00.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] First draft at a gov/rel consistency check

List inconsistencies between the governance and releases repository.

Do not merge, this is posted as an example for now. This tool will be
refined as we decide what our policy is for those inconsistencies.

Change-Id: Id263f0c91f872111fe997e2b8a1088b61033d114
'}, {'created': '2019-12-19 15:32:28.000000000', 'message': 'governance/releases consistency check tool

Introduce a new tool to list inconsistencies between the governance
and releases repository.

Sometimes governance defines release-managed deliverables, but the
release team is not handling them. Sometimes, the release management
team handles deliverables which are not an official part of OpenStack
and should probably not be listed on releases.o.o.

This tool lists both types of inconsistencies, and can be integrated
to release management process so that they are handled before becoming
an issue.

NB: Once ready, this tool could be used to replace the "membership
freeze check" tool which only looked at some of those inconsistencies.

Change-Id: Id263f0c91f872111fe997e2b8a1088b61033d114
'}, {'created': '2019-12-19 17:44:45.000000000', 'message': 'governance/releases consistency check tool

Introduce a new tool to list inconsistencies between the governance
and releases repository.

Sometimes governance defines release-managed deliverables, but the
release team is not handling them. Sometimes, the release management
team handles deliverables which are not an official part of OpenStack
and should probably not be listed on releases.o.o.

This tool lists both types of inconsistencies, and can be integrated
to release management process so that they are handled before becoming

commit_message:
governance/releases consistency check tool

Introduce a new tool to list inconsistencies between projects.yaml
in governance repository and deliverables in the releases repository.

Sometimes projects.yaml defines release-managed deliverables, but the
release team is not handling them. Sometimes, the release management
team handles deliverables which are not officially produced by an
OpenStack project team, and should probably not be listed on releases.o.o.

This tool lists both types of inconsistencies, and can be integrated
to release management process so that they are handled before becoming
an issue.

NB: Once ready, this tool could be used to replace the "membership
freeze check" tool which only looked at some of those inconsistencies.

Change-Id: Id263f0c91f872111fe997e2b8a1088b61033d114
