subject: Skip sig links if the skipped-sig flag is set
messages: [{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-05 17:33:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-05 20:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nOutput looks good.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-05 17:33:32.000000000', 'message': 'Skip sig links if the skipped-sig flag is set

In releases.o.o we display signature links for all deliverables,
if the series is > Ocata or independent. Since some "independent"
deliverables predate the signature generation tooling, that results
in a number of "independent" deliverables displaying broken signature
links, which makes us look bad.

This adds a flag (skipped-sig) that can be set for independent
deliverables that did not have any signature generated (pre-Ocata), and
skips the signature link display if the flag is set.

As a practical example, this fixes broken links for PBR<2. Tony signed
up to automatically generate the others.

Change-Id: I44a49e3f08010a85c64673d2292528139eabcc99
'}]
commit_message:
Skip sig links if the skipped-sig flag is set

In releases.o.o we display signature links for all deliverables,
if the series is > Ocata or independent. Since some "independent"
deliverables predate the signature generation tooling, that results
in a number of "independent" deliverables displaying broken signature
links, which makes us look bad.

This adds a flag (skipped-sig) that can be set for independent
deliverables that did not have any signature generated (pre-Ocata), and
skips the signature link display if the flag is set.

As a practical example, this fixes broken links for PBR<2. Tony signed
up to automatically generate the others.

Change-Id: I44a49e3f08010a85c64673d2292528139eabcc99

subject: Add release-approval pipeline
messages: [{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-05 15:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2020-02-05 15:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-02-05 16:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-02-05 20:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-05 15:50:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add release-approval pipeline

Define a release-approval pipeline to run the check-release-approval
job on every comment added to a release request, and set a
PTL-Approved label accordingly.

This may be considered a bit resource-intensive, however the
check-release-approval job is a fast python script that runs on
the executor, and only release requests shall go in this pipeline.
If this generates too much load, we could configure it to only run
when the comment posted contains a magic "signoff" keyword.

Another concern is that jobs other than check-release-approval would
be added to this pipeline. There does not seem to be a way in Zuul to
limit a pipeline to a specific job name or project.

Change-Id: Ieab04a4d6c02b216a59c12ec8599e7d91f4fffb1
'}]
commit_message:
Add release-approval pipeline

Define a release-approval pipeline to run the check-release-approval
job on every comment added to a release request, and set a
PTL-Approved label accordingly.

This may be considered a bit resource-intensive, however the
check-release-approval job is a fast python script that runs on
the executor, and only release requests shall go in this pipeline.
If this generates too much load, we could configure it to only run
when the comment posted contains a magic "signoff" keyword.

Another concern is that jobs other than check-release-approval would
be added to this pipeline. There does not seem to be a way in Zuul to
limit a pipeline to a specific job name or project.

Change-Id: Ieab04a4d6c02b216a59c12ec8599e7d91f4fffb1

commit_message:
tests: Get RoleData correctly

In Ie543782569de14d56bc41740611f7512e8357a22 a new entry was added
into the fake stack, but the indexes for any test accessing the
FAKE_STACK were not changed, effectively breaking several tests
silently.

This patch removes the direct referencing of indexes in FAKE_STACK
and uses the config utilities to get the data correctly. It also
corrects the reference to the constant UPGRADE_STEPS_MAX which no
longer exists thanks to Ie03084bb599b7b06aeeb321d2a7938a908487788

We also add mock_assert_called to several of the tests to ensure
that if the fake_role list is empty, the test will fail.

Change-Id: I08757ab389f35de52814fba48722e9325e50ab21

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-18 21:09:21.000000000', 'message': "Updates to run NUMALiveMigrationTest in tripleO

Commit introduces some bug fixes and makes minor tweaks to allow
NUMALiveMigrationTest to work in an environment deployed via TripleO.
Changes include updating config.py group name for whitebox_database to
match how it's called in test_cpu_pinning.py.  Also TripleO does not
setup mysql to listen on the same host ip as its SSH ip, so port 3306
should appened to SSHTunnelForwarder when accessing the controller(s).
Undercloud is also not setup to resolve compute/controller hostnames so
it fails setup a ServiceManager prior to doing live migration in test
test_cpu_pinning, updated to pass the host's IP instead.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5
"}, {'created': '2019-12-18 22:23:06.000000000', 'message': "Updates to run NUMALiveMigrationTest in tripleO

Commit introduces some bug fixes and makes minor tweaks to allow
NUMALiveMigrationTest to work in an environment deployed via TripleO.
Changes include updating config.py group name for whitebox_database to
match how it's called in test_cpu_pinning.py.  Also TripleO does not
setup mysql to listen on the same host ip as its SSH ip, so port 3306
should appened to SSHTunnelForwarder when accessing the controller(s).
Undercloud is also not setup to resolve compute/controller hostnames so
it fails setup a ServiceManager prior to doing live migration in test
test_cpu_pinning, updated to pass the host's IP instead.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5
"}, {'created': '2019-12-19 14:19:51.000000000', 'message': "Updates to run NUMALiveMigrationTest in tripleO

Commit introduces some bug fixes and makes minor tweaks to allow
NUMALiveMigrationTest to work in an environment deployed via TripleO.
Changes include updating config.py group name for whitebox_database to
match how it's called in test_cpu_pinning.py.  Also TripleO does not
setup mysql to listen on the same host ip as it's SSH ip, so port 3306
had to be removed from the gateway address for the SSHTunnelForwarder
when accessing the controller(s).  Undercloud is also not setup to
resolve compute/controller hostnames so it fails setting up a
ServiceManager prior to doing live migration in test test_cpu_pinning,
updated to pass the host's IP instead.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5
"}, {'created': '2019-12-19 14:54:43.000000000', 'message': "Updates to run NUMALiveMigrationTest in tripleO

Commit introduces some bug fixes and makes minor tweaks to allow
NUMALiveMigrationTest to work in an environment deployed via TripleO.
Changes include updating config.py group name for whitebox_database to
match how it's called in the services.DatabaseClient.cursor().  Also
TripleO does not setup mysql to listen on the same host ip as it's SSH
ip, so port 3306 had to be removed from the gateway address for the
SSHTunnelForwarder when accessing the controller(s).  Undercloud is also
not setup to resolve compute/controller hostnames so it fails setting up
a ServiceManager prior to doing live migration in test test_cpu_pinning,
updated to pass the host's IP instead.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5
"}, {'created': '2019-12-19 16:38:54.000000000', 'message': "Updates to run NUMALiveMigrationTest in tripleO

Commit introduces some bug fixes and makes minor tweaks to allow
NUMALiveMigrationTest to work in an environment deployed via TripleO.
Changes include updating config.py group name for whitebox_database to
match how it's called in the services.DatabaseClient.cursor().  Also
TripleO does not setup mysql to listen on the same host ip as it's SSH
ip, so port 3306 had to be removed from the gateway address for the
SSHTunnelForwarder when accessing the controller(s).  Undercloud is also
not setup to resolve compute/controller hostnames so it fails setting up
a ServiceManager prior to doing live migration in test test_cpu_pinning,
updated to pass the host's IP instead.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5
"}, {'created': '2020-01-30 23:53:52.000000000', 'message': "Updates to run NUMALiveMigrationTest in tripleO

For TripleO deployments, Undercloud is not setup to resolve
compute/controller hostnames. NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning was
updated to try and use the associated IP address configured in
[whitebox]/hypervisors when setting up it's ServiceManager. If no IP
address is available it will default to the compute's hostname instead.

Iterator pagecounts in NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_hugepages was
exhausted via a skipException check, before it was utilized to calculate
the minimum free huge pages on a host. Iterator was 'reset' by creating
a new iterator of same var name.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5
"}, {'created': '2020-01-31 00:11:09.000000000', 'message': "Updates to run NUMALiveMigrationTest in tripleO

For TripleO deployments, Undercloud is not setup to resolve
compute/controller hostnames. NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning was
updated to try and use the associated IP address configured in
[whitebox]/hypervisors when setting up it's ServiceManager. If no IP
address is available it will default to the compute's hostname instead.

The current workaround for Nova bug 1836945 was only in place in
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning, added the same work around to
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_emulator_threads.

Iterator pagecounts in NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_hugepages was
exhausted via a skipException check, before it cold be used to calculate
the minimum free huge pages on a host. Iterator was 'reset' by creating
a new iterator of same var name.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5

updated to try and use the associated IP address configured in
[whitebox]/hypervisors when setting up it's ServiceManager. If no IP
address is available it will default to the compute's hostname instead.

The current workaround for Nova bug 1836945 was only in place in
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning, added the same workaround to
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_emulator_threads.

Iterator pagecounts in NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_hugepages was
exhausted via a skipException check, before it could be used to 
calculate the minimum free huge pages on a host. Iterator was 'reset' by
creating a new iterator of same var name.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5

For downstream TripleO deployments, Undercloud is not setup to resolve
the IP addresses for compute/controller hostnames. To allow for an SSH
connection from the Undercloud to Overcloud databases,
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning was updated with a new call to
get_hypervisor_ip(). When setting up the ServiceManager() it will now
attempt to use the compute's IP address instead of the hostname. If no
IP information is found in [whitebox]/hypervisors, which is standard in
most devstack deployments, the hostname is utilized instead.  This is
the only instance where ServiceManager() utilized a hostname when
creating the service, all other ServiceManager() creations in
test_cpu_pinning.py use IP so no additional changes are necessary.

The current workaround for Nova bug 1836945 was only in place in
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning, added the same workaround to
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_emulator_threads.

exhausted via a skipException check before it could be used to calculate
the minimum free huge pages on a host. Iterator was 'reset' by creating
a new iterator of same var name.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5
"}]
commit_message:
Updates to run NUMALiveMigrationTest in tripleO

For downstream TripleO deployments, Undercloud is not setup to resolve
the IP addresses for compute/controller hostnames. To allow for an SSH
connection from the Undercloud to Overcloud databases,
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning was updated with a new call to
get_hypervisor_ip(). When setting up the ServiceManager() it will now
attempt to use the compute's IP address instead of the hostname. If no
IP information is found in [whitebox]/hypervisors, which is standard in
most devstack deployments, the hostname is utilized instead.  This is
the only instance where ServiceManager() utilized a hostname when
creating the service, all other ServiceManager() creations in
test_cpu_pinning.py use IP so no additional changes are necessary.

The current workaround for Nova bug 1836945 was only in place in
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning, added the same workaround to
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_emulator_threads.

Iterator pagecounts in NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_hugepages was
exhausted via a skipException check before it could be used to calculate
the minimum free huge pages on a host. Iterator was 'reset' by creating
a new iterator of same var name.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5

[{'created': '2020-02-05 14:25:14.000000000', 'message': "CentOS 8: Fix CentOS 7 publisher tag

Currently we use CentOS 8 nodepool images for all CI build jobs. This
means we can't use the ansible_distribution_major_version fact to detect
whether we are building CentOS 7 or 8 images. Due to this, all CentOS
images (including CentOS 7) are currently published with a
'master-centos8' tag.

This change fixes the issue by using the base_tag variable which is

Change-Id: I29b7b8ee742120107a11bd419ac58ab5c09b0b75
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8
"}]
commit_message:
CentOS 8: Fix CentOS 7 publisher tag

Currently we use CentOS 8 nodepool images for all CI build jobs. This
means we can't use the ansible_distribution_major_version fact to detect
whether we are building CentOS 7 or 8 images. Due to this, all CentOS
images (including CentOS 7) are currently published with a
'master-centos8' tag.

This change fixes the issue by using the base_tag variable which is
defined for CentOS 8 build jobs.

Change-Id: I29b7b8ee742120107a11bd419ac58ab5c09b0b75
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8

commit_message:
Remove namespace isolation support

NetworkPolicy can replicate what namespace isolation does (and much
more), so we are removing the code that is not needed

Change-Id: Ib79c21cb92c522744658a204001383b6c0e98846

commit_message:
Use Tempest v23.0.0 for Rocky testing instead of master

Tempest master is dropping the py3.5 support[1] and last
tag work well with py3.5 is 23.0.0.

Stable/rocky jobs use xenail node which has py3.5 version.

Related--Bug: 1861308
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704840/

Change-Id: Idc51a898944b087c7a5982c3451b88eeb1af6e6a

commit_message:
Force arp_responder to True when DVR and tunneling enabled

After [1] and [2], the ARP responder needs to be enabled
if DVR and tunneling are enabled or ARP will not work. If
it is False we will log a message and force it to True.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/651905/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/653883/

Change-Id: I934062c970effe5194056b0786f84f3246850701
Related-bug: #1774459
(cherry picked from commit ea85e39660abaa224c159c42214fdb7042302bea)

commit_message:
Add voting k2k tests

With the addition of K2K-specific tests in the tempest plugin and a
config toggle in the plugin to disable use of the external IdP, we can
safely add a voting federation job. This also fixes the devstack plugin
to install the xmlsec1 tool which is needed for K2K.

Change-Id: I9dc634e073657ff337751ec67363a57bd10e20d4
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/689222
(cherry picked from commit fb0be8e59917b5b637926d9526a64676af07ebf0)

commit_message:
nova-net: Remove now unnecessary nova-net workaround

We removed the comment for this workaround in change
Ifa9c5c468400261a5e1f66b72c575845173a4f8f but failed to remove the
workaround itself. Resolve this now.

Change-Id: I0a5b17f5b38ae3c2877fd8ea496047f8e56f3358
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Reset timeout exception in DietTestCase when retrying

In case of fixtures.TimeoutException, DietTestCase retries the
execution of the test case (introduced in [1]). But the timeout
fixture was not reset. This can lead to a general execution timeout
if a test do not exit in a proper time.

[1] If865c4683645f9bd11f5e1b528bade0547505bfd

Related-Bug: #1843478
Partial-Bug: #1848944
Change-Id: Ib6ef58b5259ea4bf151e866f6244ff87b195b139
(cherry picked from commit 4f59db2fab33e39f3d101885263e5f6483ad2b94)

[{'created': '2020-01-30 12:43:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error handling on add/remove router iface calls

Ib1f880f75e511faaf8c798da22b9ca54dd441166 was manually processing call
results to raise SDKException. Instead of that
exception.raise_from_response() should be used to make sure a correct
exception class is thrown (e.g. NotFoundException on 404 results) and
this commit fixes this.

Story: #2006679
Task: #38575
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error handling on add/remove router iface calls

Ib1f880f75e511faaf8c798da22b9ca54dd441166 was manually processing call
results to raise SDKException. Instead of that
exception.raise_from_response() should be used to make sure a correct
exception class is thrown (e.g. NotFoundException on 404 results) and
this commit fixes this.

Change-Id: I76b33e6c870971cdf50938d1328445702c83b64a
Story: #2006679
Task: #38575

commit_message:
nova-libvirt: add UEFI packages to support UEFI instances

Fix inability to run UEFI-based images/instances by installing UEFI
packages also in nova-libvirt image which is not based on nova-base.

Includes support for C8.
Backport below Train w/o C8.

Closes-Bug: #1814552
Co-authored-by: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>
Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1d5cd3d9af98444acac5bedd7daeaa6c6673dcd6
(cherry picked from commit 15b68c15c1dd0c2df1cc49b550f2fa03a4c65e8e)

commit_message:
Complete "Drop python2 support" goal

We stopped testing python2, but there are more things to be cleanup.

- Remove python2 entries from setup.cfg
- Add releasenotes
- remove universal wheel since this is only python 3 now

Change-Id: Ie2bbb4d34b8411939ad5cfd750fc76c933779542

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Tricircle is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ia1352479bf3148ca68c432acf30cd55290d8bd3e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-10 13:21:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the barbicanclient installation not from source

- follow the standard installation pattern for barbicanclient:
  only clones if it is installed from source. This way it is
  possible to install and test barbicanclient from pip
  by default, additional jobs can simply add it
  to required-projects;
- define the repository metadata using the GIT* arrays.
  They are also defined by stackrc, but they should be probably
  removed from there;
- remove the useless call of configure_barbicanclient (the same
  steps are already performed by install_barbicanclient).
  Going forward, configure_barbicanclient can be removed

Change-Id: Iea1cd3f82c3b38f03f91b0191846e1ddbbfb1d6c
(cherry picked from commit 646a0360b97d09146cb3b9a4d9bef927d074c239)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the barbicanclient installation not from source

- follow the standard installation pattern for barbicanclient:
  only clones if it is installed from source. This way it is
  possible to install and test barbicanclient from pip
  by default, additional jobs can simply add it
  to required-projects;
- define the repository metadata using the GIT* arrays.
  They are also defined by stackrc, but they should be probably
  removed from there;
- remove the useless call of configure_barbicanclient (the same
  steps are already performed by install_barbicanclient).
  Going forward, configure_barbicanclient can be removed

Change-Id: Iea1cd3f82c3b38f03f91b0191846e1ddbbfb1d6c
(cherry picked from commit 646a0360b97d09146cb3b9a4d9bef927d074c239)

(1 comment)

two issues still present:
1) most important: running cron interfering there (actually this might be the very reason we had issues so it's not going anywhere!)
2) redeploy/reconfigure may break if we add a new node to the beginning (or it happens due to randomness) - this was present there and is not going anywhere unless we force user to select the fernet initializer, this does not affect CI though

I also find it a bit awkward to do it in handlers. Maybe stay with the original approach, move fernet init before flush, bring up the required containers WITHOUT cron first, do the init and distribution, shutoff the containers, and then flush handlers."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-12 20:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Also, I think we can actually attack (2) by using the same approach as with detecting existing ceph mon.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-12-13 06:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

2019-12-13 05:57:29.275 54 ERROR keystone     keystone_user_id, keystone_group_id, 'fernet_tokens')
2019-12-13 05:57:29.275 54 ERROR keystone   File "/var/lib/kolla/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keystone/cmd/cli.py", line 422, in rotate_fernet_repository
2019-12-13 05:57:29.275 54 ERROR keystone     futils.rotate_keys(keystone_user_id, keystone_group_id)
2019-12-13 05:57:29.275 54 ERROR keystone   File "/var/lib/kolla/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keystone/common/fernet_utils.py", line 225, in rotate_keys
2019-12-13 05:57:29.275 54 ERROR keystone     current_primary_key = max(key_files.keys())
2019-12-13 05:57:29.275 54 ERROR keystone ValueError: max() arg is an empty sequence
2019-12-13 05:57:29.275 54 ERROR keystone

Of course still we can get hit by a situation that it would run just AFTER the fernet_setup - but in worst case scenario it will just rotate the keys.

 > 2) redeploy/reconfigure may break if we add a new node to the
 > beginning (or it happens due to randomness) - this was present
 > there and is not going anywhere unless we force user to select the
 > fernet initializer, this does not affect CI though

may break how? please describe the scenario in detail ;-)

 > 
 > I also find it a bit awkward to do it in handlers. Maybe stay with
 > the original approach, move fernet init before flush, bring up the
 > required containers WITHOUT cron first, do the init and
 > distribution, shutoff the containers, and then flush handlers.

we are using handlers here to not duplicate the code, as I wrote before - cron has no effect as described earlier.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-12-13 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-12-13 06:16:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-13 08:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

First and foremost, not to be misunderstood, I believe this change makes fernet initialization handling BETTER (not worse) than before.

Ad 1) Let me read those cron scripts, I skimmed over them yesterday. :D

Ad 2) The same as before the change. If you add a new node and it ends up the 0th node, it will run its initialization and distribution (missing the proper rotation). This might lead to at least some weirdness.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-13 09:34:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

1) I don't understand the cron issue. We have stopped rotating during deploy - only setup then push.

2) I see your point about scale out, although it's not new. How about:

* Try to find a keystone with keys (similar to mariadb recovery logic maybe).
* If no existing keystone, run fernet_setup on any keystone
* Push keys. From existing keystone if one exists, or from the one that ran fernet_setup."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-13 09:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

1) Nah, the cron really looks like a noop, possibly with irrelevant error messages but meh, can be ignored I guess.

2) Yes, analogically to Ceph or MariaDB as you suggest.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-12-13 13:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-13 14:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-15 10:36:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

I still think it's an overkill the way it's done now.

My idea is this:
fernet init belongs to bootstrap.
1) Establish host which will do the init (or establish that init is not to be done then skip all init stuff).
2) Run the init on that host.
3) Ensure distribution runs in handlers before keystone is started.
4) Profit.

Current proposal is close to this, but not quite."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-12-16 08:02:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> I still think it's an overkill the way it's done now.
 > 
 > My idea is this:
 > fernet init belongs to bootstrap.
 > 1) Establish host which will do the init (or establish that init is
 > not to be done then skip all init stuff).
 > 2) Run the init on that host.
 > 3) Ensure distribution runs in handlers before keystone is started.
 > 4) Profit.
 > 
 > Current proposal is close to this, but not quite.

To run init not from handlers, but from bootstrap - we would need to start the bloody container in bootstrap - I'm not fancy doing this, since it's doubling the code.
What's wrong in running that in handlers? And why is that an overkill? ;-)"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-16 15:27:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-16 15:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Fiddly stuff.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-16 15:31:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Given that every host needs a keystone_ssh container running, we need to do everything either in the handlers or use a two phase approach. We could do the check for 'is keystone fernet running' then during bootstrap, then trigger the necessary handler for the correct host rather than doing the push."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-12-16 15:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-12 12:22:39.000000000', 'message': "Restart keystone container after fernet bootstrap

There are cases when a multinode deployment ends up in unusable
keystone public wsgi on some nodes.

The root cause is that keystone public wsgi doesn't find fernet
keys on startup - and then persists on sending 500 errors to any
requests.

Change-Id: I63709c2e3f6a893db82a05640da78f492bf8440f
Closes-Bug: #1846789
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/698702

keystone public wsgi on some nodes.

keys on startup - and then persists on sending 500 errors to any
requests - due to a race condition between

commit_message:
Fix keystone fernet bootstrap

There are cases when a multinode deployment ends up in unusable
keystone public wsgi on some nodes.

The root cause is that keystone public wsgi doesn't find fernet
keys on startup - and then persists on sending 500 errors to any
requests - due to a race condition between
fernet_setup/fernet-push.sh and keystone startup.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/703742/
Change-Id: I63709c2e3f6a893db82a05640da78f492bf8440f
Closes-Bug: #1846789

commit_message:
Convert network policy non-voting job to use Ceph

This patchset changes the Zuul network policy job to use Ceph
instead of NFS file system, and deploys Cinder as well, so that
the policies for all Openstack services can be deployed and tested
in one job.

Change-Id: I40d7bbeb9d131106b6f2d667ea809d429ad1a6be

Remove openshift routes(Ingress) support

Route pods from openshift can be used instead and the code
is not being used/maintained.

Change-Id: I76448752ba07f4b30dbfa783c2ae99d46e730eaf

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

Change-Id: Ie0015353ec57b2daa9ff626961c142289ac18069
'}]
commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2.
requirements.txt is updated accordingly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
Change-Id: Ie0015353ec57b2daa9ff626961c142289ac18069

commit_message:
Change fetch_fernet_tokens.py behaviour to check for minimum number of tokens

Change is required to properly implement logic in fernet-node-sync.sh on
kolla-ansible side - to add a check if fernet key store is populated with
required number of tokens.

Change-Id: I51ed61e34a1dd79532b4528e56a9cd9011d46e6d
Related-Bug: #1846789
(cherry picked from commit 267cb8b14ae8472d00e09c2b5e35bda7de2de54f)

commit_message:
Change fetch_fernet_tokens.py behaviour to check for minimum number of tokens

Change is required to properly implement logic in fernet-node-sync.sh on
kolla-ansible side - to add a check if fernet key store is populated with
required number of tokens.

Change-Id: I51ed61e34a1dd79532b4528e56a9cd9011d46e6d
Related-Bug: #1846789

(cherry picked from commit 646a0360b97d09146cb3b9a4d9bef927d074c239)

commit_message:
Fix the barbicanclient installation not from source

- follow the standard installation pattern for barbicanclient:
  only clones if it is installed from source. This way it is
  possible to install and test barbicanclient from pip
  by default, additional jobs can simply add it
  to required-projects;
- define the repository metadata using the GIT* arrays.
  They are also defined by stackrc, but they should be probably
  removed from there;
- remove the useless call of configure_barbicanclient (the same
  steps are already performed by install_barbicanclient).
  Going forward, configure_barbicanclient can be removed

Change-Id: Iea1cd3f82c3b38f03f91b0191846e1ddbbfb1d6c
(cherry picked from commit 646a0360b97d09146cb3b9a4d9bef927d074c239)

commit_message:
Handle saving too big messages in last_error field

If the deployment using ansible deploy interface fails, the error
returned from ansible might be quite substantial. In some cases it
can be more than 64KiB, which is the limit of the last_error field
in the nodes table (for most database backends). As the deployment
error is saved into database as-is, there is a possibility of
failure to save this info in the database. This change fixes this
issue by saving "see the logs" message into the last_error field.

Story: 2007266
Task: 38659

Change-Id: I5f7003efd5108264e54d6e45aabf680bb86a04ea

commit_message:
s/assertItemsEqual/assertCountEqual/g

assertItemsEqual was renamed to assertCountEqual in Python 3, and the
testsuite is failing now - rename it.
See also https://six.readthedocs.io/#six.assertCountEqual

This unbreaks the testsuite.

Change-Id: I3cce625c3cad6303f99198ba1c91f59f6f5add41

commit_message:
Set the delayed call "key" field to the right value

* The field "key" of the DelayedCall class must be set to the right
  value. It allows to significantly optimize performance of workflows
  with "join" tasks. However, it was broken during the refactoring
  in the summer of 2019. This patch fixes it.
* Added another profiler trace decorator.

Closes-Bug: #1861988
Change-Id: I247b674d8a358795871cfa87bcdf29f4857ca2d8

commit_message:
Update the lb_id on an amp earlier if we know it

When we create amphora for specific loadbalancer it would be
good to get info about mapping pair loadbalancer-amphora as
soon as possible.

For example, if admin needs to debug connectivity issues with amphora
VMs - loadbalancer_id won't be set until AmphoraComputeConnectivityWait
task succeeds (which is never for such case) so they have to go to worker
logs to understand which amphora is related to a currently creating
loadbalancer.

Co-Authored-By: Ann Taraday <akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I865445af34bc63b90d965ef5e2c8f9f49aa9c2f3

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 2.0.0

Fix the issues raised by this bump.

Upgrading to 2.0.0 allows a more recent version of pyflakes to be
installed, which is required to handle type annotations.

Change-Id: Ie1820df503bf102397433a93dfe307401b46daba

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-05 13:03:39.000000000', 'message': "Ensure the facter cache has at most one writer

If the host's facter pre-cache step fails, the container-puppet
executions will fail with some other error around facts. If we want to
skip the cache, then we need to not mount the folder as read-only as
that has other effects. Neither can we mount it as RW because
of the multiple container puppet config processes can access it
simultaneously.

To solve that issue, make sure the facter cache has at most writer
for its lower overlayfs layer. While the upper layer can take only
ephemeral updates from another container puppet config processes,
if any has to fix the cache or whatnot.

To achieve that behavior, check if the facter cache path appears
to be already mounted on the host. If it is use the overlay mode (:O)
instead.

This solution only works for podman and not docker.

Change-Id: I2a0362418ce59cfeea460458ac8778a438b14ee9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure the facter cache has at most one writer

If the host's facter pre-cache step fails, the container-puppet
executions will fail with some other error around facts. If we want to
skip the cache, then we need to not mount the folder as read-only as
that has other effects. Neither can we mount it as RW because
of the multiple container puppet config processes can access it
simultaneously.

To solve that issue, make sure the facter cache has no more than a
single writer for its lower overlayfs layer. While the upper layer can
take only ephemeral updates from another container puppet config
processes, if any has to fix the cache or whatnot.

To achieve that behavior, check if the facter cache path appears
to be already mounted on the host. If it is use the overlay mode (:O)
instead.

This solution only works for podman >1.4 and not docker.

Closes-bug: #1861917

Change-Id: I2a0362418ce59cfeea460458ac8778a438b14ee9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move environment to a var fo easier debugging

If we configure the environment vars as an internal variable it allows
us to print them out with the command when debugging is enabled.

Change-Id: Ida7b9f1a4c3b27c7f702bf47d5992646eb34430c

commit_message:
Fix py3 gate

Netaddr library is supported in py2 and py3. We should be using it
instead of relying on ipaddress, which is only supported in py3.

Co-Authored-By: Michał Dulko <mdulko@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I93ee6343a66de1adcaca800e0614da72a4df60d9

[{'created': '2020-01-30 16:47:31.000000000', 'message': 'Skip read-only devices with metadata erase

HPE "Virtual Install Devices" appear as read-only block
devices, and may... or may not be visible depending on the
bios configuration state.

These devices can no longer be disabled from the bios settings
so the simplest course of action seems to be that we should
handle the existence of a read-only device.

In the event of secure erase, this is treated as a hard failure
case and a driver_internal_info flag has been added to enable
a future bypass method for knowledgable operators.

Change-Id: Ief8b360d11e654d8fae3a04a2a9f8d474a06e167

commit_message:
Skip read-only devices with metadata erase

HPE "Virtual Install Devices" appear as read-only block
devices, and may... or may not be visible depending on the
bios configuration state.

These devices can no longer be disabled from the bios settings
so the simplest course of action seems to be that we should
handle the existence of a read-only device.

In the event of secure erase, this is treated as a hard failure
case and a driver_internal_info flag has been added to enable
a future bypass method for knowledgable operators.

Backport note: the unit tests have been modified to account for Python 2

Conflicts:
	ironic_python_agent/hardware.py
	ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_hardware.py

Change-Id: Ief8b360d11e654d8fae3a04a2a9f8d474a06e167
Story: 2007229
Task: 38502
(cherry picked from commit cd7b2693f873bde72706f8b6ab8c1f21e68f0fd1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-31 11:48:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix bug: AttributeError arises while sorting with standard attributes

Common neutron resource(e.g, Port) consists of:
1. Resource Attributes, e.g: Port.mac_address, etc.
2. Standard Attributes, e.g: created_at, and are shared among all
   neutron resources.
The `sort` opt only supports limited attributes. We need to filter
attributes that are defined with `is_sort_key=True` and it's preferred
to explicitly warn CLI & API users of illegal sort keys rather than
just accept without check, pass forward and then hit a internal error
which's quite confusing.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660097/
Change-Id: I8d206f909b09f1279dfcdc25c39989a67bff93d5
Closes-Bug: #1659175
(cherry picked from commit 335ac4e2d95c164d66a3b09d9fd08e9c563edfc2)
"}, {'created': '2020-02-03 11:02:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix bug: AttributeError arises while sorting with standard attributes

Common neutron resource(e.g, Port) consists of:
1. Resource Attributes, e.g: Port.mac_address, etc.
2. Standard Attributes, e.g: created_at, and are shared among all
   neutron resources.
The `sort` opt only supports limited attributes. We need to filter
attributes that are defined with `is_sort_key=True` and it's preferred
to explicitly warn CLI & API users of illegal sort keys rather than
just accept without check, pass forward and then hit a internal error
which's quite confusing.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660097/
Change-Id: I8d206f909b09f1279dfcdc25c39989a67bff93d5

(cherry picked from commit 335ac4e2d95c164d66a3b09d9fd08e9c563edfc2)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bug: AttributeError arises while sorting with standard attributes

Common neutron resource(e.g, Port) consists of:
1. Resource Attributes, e.g: Port.mac_address, etc.
2. Standard Attributes, e.g: created_at, and are shared among all
   neutron resources.
The `sort` opt only supports limited attributes. We need to filter
attributes that are defined with `is_sort_key=True` and it's preferred
to explicitly warn CLI & API users of illegal sort keys rather than
just accept without check, pass forward and then hit a internal error
which's quite confusing.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660097/
Change-Id: I8d206f909b09f1279dfcdc25c39989a67bff93d5
Closes-Bug: #1659175
(cherry picked from commit 335ac4e2d95c164d66a3b09d9fd08e9c563edfc2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-31 17:30:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix resource schemas and releated `get_sorts` test cases

When I'm trying to introduce a central sort-keys validation within
patch [1] to `get_sorts` method in `neutron.api.api_common` module,
I get blocked by some resource schemas and test cases. After reading
neutron API docs and some inspection, I believe there exists uses of
improper sort keys in test cases and some resource schemes need to
keep aligned with offical documents.

* Schemas of resource SecurityGroups/SG Rules/Segments don't provide
`is_sort_key` flag for their sort key properties claimed in offical
docs as neutron-lib does. See [2] for more details.

* Test cases of resource NetworkSegmentRange use unsupported sort keys,
e.g: physical_network. Replace it with `name` property. See [2] for more
details.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/653903/
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html

Change-Id: I45a51736e4075e3dbc16827486869d70b659622d
(cherry picked from commit ed3f1087fa354a91721d3046ce134e18c86f22b3)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix resource schemas and releated `get_sorts` test cases

When I'm trying to introduce a central sort-keys validation within
patch [1] to `get_sorts` method in `neutron.api.api_common` module,
I get blocked by some resource schemas and test cases. After reading
neutron API docs and some inspection, I believe there exists uses of
improper sort keys in test cases and some resource schemes need to
keep aligned with offical documents.

* Schemas of resource SecurityGroups/SG Rules/Segments don't provide
`is_sort_key` flag for their sort key properties claimed in offical
docs as neutron-lib does. See [2] for more details.

* Test cases of resource NetworkSegmentRange use unsupported sort keys,
e.g: physical_network. Replace it with `name` property. See [2] for more
details.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/653903/
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html

Change-Id: I45a51736e4075e3dbc16827486869d70b659622d
(cherry picked from commit ed3f1087fa354a91721d3046ce134e18c86f22b3)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Karbor is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: Id923a1e18a1ba2439eda11a88abab64a3b32cab1

[{'created': '2020-01-22 07:45:42.000000000', 'message': 'Change fetch_fernet_tokens.py behaviour to check for minimum number of tokens

Change is required to properly implement logic in fernet-node-sync.sh on
kolla-ansible side - to add a check if fernet key store is populated with
required number of tokens.

Change-Id: I51ed61e34a1dd79532b4528e56a9cd9011d46e6d
Related-Bug: #1846789
'}]
commit_message:
Change fetch_fernet_tokens.py behaviour to check for minimum number of tokens

Change is required to properly implement logic in fernet-node-sync.sh on
kolla-ansible side - to add a check if fernet key store is populated with
required number of tokens.

Change-Id: I51ed61e34a1dd79532b4528e56a9cd9011d46e6d
Related-Bug: #1846789

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-07 07:03:38.000000000', 'message': 'Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2.
requirements.txt is updated accordingly.
For more info. please refer [1], [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: Ifc49a69d4b34b32d64a95cca488c3a1ab7eb2ef6

commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2.
requirements.txt is updated accordingly.
For more info. please refer [1], [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: Ifc49a69d4b34b32d64a95cca488c3a1ab7eb2ef6

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

karbor-dashboard is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: Ic69bd25a9be7b512c0341e524e67e04f81217214

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Remove install_command from tox.ini as cleanup.
Switch to Ussuri jobs

Change-Id: I1a3b3e542f2a6cb03f98d80ec5685c315031eed7

Some images will probably need to go to UNBUILDABLE:

- mongodb

Some images will probably need to go to UNBUILDABLE:

- mongodb

commit_message:
WIP: move to CentOS 8 in containers

It is time to move to CentOS 8.

Still many things are missing:

- sensu
- shellinabox
- uwsgi-plugin-python3

We have to wait for Storage SIG, Virt SIG, OpsTools SIG etc.

Also external repos are not ready:

- elasticsearch
- grafana (albeit centos7 package installs)
- kibana
- HA (pacemaker, crmsh, corosync)
- td-agent
- opendaylight

Some images will probably need to go to UNBUILDABLE:

- mongodb

Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-python3

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/693544
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/702196

Change-Id: I05baddc1e3af257ddd50d0cc80efd3bea6125406

commit_message:
nova-net: Remove use of legacy 'SecurityGroup' object

While we can't remove this entirely, we can remove most of the users of
it. Do that.

Change-Id: Ie19ca6d5f9b7800ee43fdc72411cfe64f3eb7544
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Temporarily skipped to merge fix encoding/decoding in paging of universal describer class.

"Fix encoding/decoding in paging of universal describer class" is not related with temporarily skipped 5 tests, but cannot be merged with master unless all tests are passed. These 5 tests will be fixed by another bugfixes.

Change-Id: I7c965be70ca9a97615dd7d518eb2f6b82792e5a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-04 17:22:31.000000000', 'message': "Remove side-car containers in Create status

The change Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323 added a mechanism
to remove side-car containers before spawning a new one for the same
network.

For dnsmasq side-car, it matches on container statuses Exited
and Created, while all remaining containers match on Exited only.
However if a node running side-car is shut down ungracefully, containers
end in Created status and wrapper script won't be able to start the
containers because they already exist.

This change goes only to Train because in current master (Ussuri) these
wrappers were replaced by ansible.

Change-Id: I7909cd18c7a123d64d24ebc33167d415a8cfb228
"}]
commit_message:
Remove side-car containers in Create status

The change Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323 added a mechanism
to remove side-car containers before spawning a new one for the same
network.

For dnsmasq side-car, it matches on container statuses Exited
and Created, while all remaining containers match on Exited only.
However if a node running side-car is shut down ungracefully, containers
end in Created status and wrapper script won't be able to start the
containers because they already exist.

This change goes only to Train because in current master (Ussuri) these
wrappers were replaced by ansible.

Change-Id: I7909cd18c7a123d64d24ebc33167d415a8cfb228

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-20 11:44:46.000000000', 'message': 'Remove log compression before upload

From #openstack-infra:
fungi> jrosser: there was a necessary change in handling of
compressed log files, jobs should not compress logs on their
own now if you want them to be viewable in a browser (this
was to solve a problem where tarballs were getting silently
decompressed on download without changing their filenames to
drop the .gz extension)

This is a patch direct to the Rocky branch as the log collection
is significantly refactored in Stein so the master branch change
cannot be backported to Rocky.

Change-Id: Ic96e23f93e989c982be99927b0883d9345ce1acd
'}]
commit_message:
Remove log compression before upload

From #openstack-infra:
fungi> jrosser: there was a necessary change in handling of
compressed log files, jobs should not compress logs on their
own now if you want them to be viewable in a browser (this
was to solve a problem where tarballs were getting silently
decompressed on download without changing their filenames to
drop the .gz extension)

This is a patch direct to the Rocky branch as the log collection
is significantly refactored in Stein so the master branch change
cannot be backported to Rocky.

Change-Id: Ic96e23f93e989c982be99927b0883d9345ce1acd

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-03 11:26:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pep8 error in py37

While running PEP8 in python3.7 environment, will met the
following exception:
"RuntimeError: generator raised StopIteration"
This is an known issue in py3.7, and had been fixed in Pylint 2.x.

After upgrade Pylint to 2.2.0, the issue is:
"AttributeError: 'Import' object has no
attribute 'infer_name_module' on import"
This issue was fixed in Pylint 2.3.0.

So upgrades Pylint to 2.3.0, this patch also
adds some refactor recommendations in .pylintrc[1]

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/789057/

Change-Id: I2b3983e3653d92c5b12f233b57fb4467df1da83d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pep8 error in py37

While running PEP8 in python3.7 environment, will met the
following exception:
"RuntimeError: generator raised StopIteration"
This is an known issue in py3.7, and had been fixed in Pylint 2.x.

After upgrade Pylint to 2.2.0, the issue is:
"AttributeError: 'Import' object has no
attribute 'infer_name_module' on import"
This issue was fixed in Pylint 2.3.0.

So upgrades Pylint to 2.3.0, this patch also
adds some refactor recommendations in .pylintrc[1]

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/789057/

Change-Id: I2b3983e3653d92c5b12f233b57fb4467df1da83d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-09 18:59:10.000000000', 'message': 'SSC.disks_sizes_bytes handle CapacityBytes is None

In the open ocean, a Redfish service can return a SimpleStorage resource
containing a Device property with its CapacityBytes property set to
null. According to the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) schema
for SimpleStorage, the type of CapacityBytes can be either integer or
null [1].

The Dell integrated Dell Remote Access Controller (iDRAC) 9 running
Lifecycle Controller firmware version 3.30.30.30 returns that for a Dell
EMC PowerEdge R740xd containing a Dell HBA 330 12Gbps SAS Host Bus
Adapter Controller (non-RAID), MiniCard (HBA 330 Mini) [2]. The HBA 330
Mini firmware version is 16.17.00.03.

The same was observed against an R740xd running Lifecycle Controller
firmware version 3.34.34.34.

This changes the SimpleStorageCollection.disks_size_bytes property to
process only Disks with CapacityByes not set to None.

[1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/SimpleStorage.v1_2_3.json
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2019-12-11.log.html#t2019-12-11T07:24:17

Change-Id: I57a0074a7f6c4495e7c73a00c87675ea87fdb6e8
Story: 2006918
Task: 37567
(cherry picked from commit 9d01756833ec97a05f301a4fa1e8b2511d7c5c74)
'}]
commit_message:
SSC.disks_sizes_bytes handle CapacityBytes is None

In the open ocean, a Redfish service can return a SimpleStorage resource
containing a Device property with its CapacityBytes property set to
null. According to the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) schema
for SimpleStorage, the type of CapacityBytes can be either integer or
null [1].

The Dell integrated Dell Remote Access Controller (iDRAC) 9 running
Lifecycle Controller firmware version 3.30.30.30 returns that for a Dell
EMC PowerEdge R740xd containing a Dell HBA 330 12Gbps SAS Host Bus
Adapter Controller (non-RAID), MiniCard (HBA 330 Mini) [2]. The HBA 330
Mini firmware version is 16.17.00.03.

The same was observed against an R740xd running Lifecycle Controller
firmware version 3.34.34.34.

This changes the SimpleStorageCollection.disks_size_bytes property to
process only Disks with CapacityByes not set to None.

[1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/SimpleStorage.v1_2_3.json
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2019-12-11.log.html#t2019-12-11T07:24:17

Change-Id: I57a0074a7f6c4495e7c73a00c87675ea87fdb6e8
Story: 2006918
Task: 37567
(cherry picked from commit 9d01756833ec97a05f301a4fa1e8b2511d7c5c74)

commit_message:
Support node retirement

This change adds support for node retirement: nodes can
have additional properties 'retired' and 'retired_reason'
which change the way the nodes (can) traverse the FSM
and which operations are allowed. In particular:
- retired nodes cannot move from manageable to available;
- upon instance deletion, retired nodes move to manageable
  (rather than available).

Story: #2005425
Task: #38142

Change-Id: I8113a44c28f62bf83f8e213aeb6704f96055d52b

commit_message:
Support query user messages by timestamp

Add support for querying user messages by specifying a timestamp, which
will be compared to the created_at field, and manila will return all the
messages matching to the time condition.

Partially-Implements: blueprint query-user-message-by-timestamp

Change-Id: I357c198990a92e2ac61ece24df129f9878aa7b64

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

'}]
commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ibea136743f9a82d0e9ff35bc59f54a4c8afda74b

commit_message:
Minor improvements to cell commands

It adds a bit more verbosity to cell update command, so that it
is more obvious for an operator which values are being used as
transport URL or database connection URL for a cell.

Change-Id: Ie567ae7da4508a4b6f797d4bc77347c84702a74e

commit_message:
CentOS 8: Deploy CentOS 8 containers

* HAProxy is now 1.8 in CentOS 8
* Support python3 in baremetal role
* Remove support for environments without python2 installed (this could
  not have worked since we gather facts before this point)

Workarounds:

* Using CentOS 7 yum repo for Docker, with module_hotfixes

Change-Id: I30bd3d58f6224ad4c9575ba66c74deabe6895cc4
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8

commit_message:
Ensure tox registers failures properly

Tox runs tests via unit_tests.sh which when not
running a test subset will mean tox only checks for
the final exit code. This means horizon test failues
will not be seen by tox unless openstack_dashboard
tests also fail.

This change forces an exit code which !=0 if either
test run fails.

Change-Id: I8fbcb834d9817e7eea1b2c39fc4caab6004b981b
(cherry picked from commit 280848c55ffeb8cfe948acd5f2ca234d2c1264f5)

commit_message:
operation_log: Log mask_fields only when exists in request

Previously mask_fields are always output even when they are
not included in a user request. It is confusing.

Change-Id: Ia207bfbc61246bc722a2ced544a8955f52025c0c
Closes-Bug: #1675191
(cherry picked from commit d04f164ab2d2472e181226201a68feaaf1454450)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-16 09:31:13.000000000', 'message': "mysql: configure maximum connection lifetime

Ensure that any server side termination of MySQL connections is
handled well by configuring a maximum connection lifetime of
3600 seconds. This is inline with defaults in OpenStack/oslo.db
and is typically equal to or less that the wait_timeout configured
in MySQL or Percona XtraDB Cluster.  The default is '0' which
means connections will be used forever.

Longer term solution to this issue is to pass the configured
wait_timeout in MySQL on the shared-db relation so clients can
be configured consistently with the MySQL server.

Change-Id: Icd76caae0ff56fc5a27ea08399cbc6af59852897
Related-Bug: 1841063
"}]
commit_message:
mysql: configure maximum connection lifetime

Ensure that any server side termination of MySQL connections is
handled well by configuring a maximum connection lifetime of
3600 seconds. This is inline with defaults in OpenStack/oslo.db
and is typically equal to or less that the wait_timeout configured
in MySQL or Percona XtraDB Cluster.  The default is '0' which
means connections will be used forever.

Longer term solution to this issue is to pass the configured
wait_timeout in MySQL on the shared-db relation so clients can
be configured consistently with the MySQL server.

Change-Id: Icd76caae0ff56fc5a27ea08399cbc6af59852897
Related-Bug: 1841063

commit_message:
Enable API TLS in the functional test

Add vault to the functional test bundle and enable TLS on all
charms that support it.

We want the functional tests to validate operation of Octavia with
multiple units.  When using TLS this will not work without also
enabling HA because of certificate hostname mismatch.  Remove all
non-HA bundles and do HA by default.

Change-Id: Ib1aafe0c26abc8876e073942fda2e4a1ecabbbb2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-04 15:05:09.000000000', 'message': 'Relax from python3.6 to python3 command in tox.ini

After merging below changeset:
 https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703011/

Jobs based on Fedora platform started failing:
 https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/job/devstack-platform-fedora-latest

The reason is tox.ini requires python3.6 command while
python3-devel package provided could install python3.7
command.

The way to fix this problem is just executing python3
command instead of python3.6 command for executing test
cases, leaving the choice of the actual interpreter
version to be used to the resting environment.

Change-Id: I9900195b9edd656805c8ba426b8b2a8725e13359
'}]
commit_message:
Relax from python3.6 to python3 command in tox.ini

After merging below changeset:
 https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703011/

Jobs based on Fedora platform started failing:
 https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/job/devstack-platform-fedora-latest

The reason is tox.ini requires python3.6 command while
python3-devel package provided could install python3.7
command.

The way to fix this problem is just executing python3
command instead of python3.6 command for executing test
cases, leaving the choice of the actual interpreter
version to be used to the resting environment.

Change-Id: I9900195b9edd656805c8ba426b8b2a8725e13359

subject: Add job for testing support for CentOS-7 platform
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27329, 'name': 'Federico Ressi', 'email': 'fressi@redhat.com', 'username': 'fressi_redhat'}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'email': 'radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com', 'username': 'yoctozepto'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-02-04 15:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-02-04 15:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-02-04 15:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-02-04 19:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-02-04 19:52:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

rebased on 3.6 change to pass; will update to +2 if it passes'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-02-04 20:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

thanks'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-02-04 22:47:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

please do not merge this, we removed the centos-7 job on master with Id9ef507dd6f4226d65c6ed3043666b0aa6a3bd1c.

devstack on centos does not work by itself -- it relies on RDO repositories for critical packages, and RDO are not supporting python3 on centos 7.  Maybe this works right now.  But if *anything* goes wrong between any of the multitude of libraries used with openstack and the underlying packages it will be broken, and there will be no support for getting anything fixed.

Why anyone would want to base their CI on something they know is likely to break, and if it does break they will have no community to debug or fix issues, nor have any realistic chance of getting any fixes they do make ever merged, I do not understand.  I have proposed If98581708568e7a8d15e6edc588a008df0cac0fb to explain this to people, who can then use FORCE if they want to go ahead anyway.

But I do not think we should spend infra resources on this, or mislead people into thinking it is anything other than an unsupported configuration.  Our time and resources are better put towards centos 8 support.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-02-05 08:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

This also seems to break the fedora job.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-02-05 09:13:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

breaks Fedora and I understand Ian's concerns; this is ussuri so no support from c7 any longer"}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-02-05 10:18:35.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

fedora job is anyway broken because it is using python3.7 while tempest tox.ini explicitly requires python3.6. Fedora job is expected to be fixed soon (hopefully) by relaxing tempest requirements. What I don't understand is why fedora has python37 package and not 'python37-devel' package. It looks to be the node RPM repos are not properly configured. RHEL8 and Centos8 should have python36 package and both platform are going to be used more than Fedora by end customer I think. Fedora is always unestable and it changes too often. Is not a waste of time supporting it instead of focusing on any CentOS that are pretty stable and don't change so much along the years? Regarding all other concerns regarding CentOS 7 suppor I understand them. I am investigating on moving on with CentOS 8 support. Anyway CentOS 7 is working fine, despite all your concerns. Python 3.6 is working fine no matter which platform you use and openstack on CentOS 7 is relying on it. Other things is what concern binary packages required by OpenStack components and I see your point therefore I am going to abandon this change. :-("}]

commit_message:
Add job for testing support for CentOS-7 platform

This implement installation of required python3x package
for RedHat family distros with package name depending on
configurable ${PYTHON3_VERSION}. Examples:

  3 => python3-devel
  3.6 => python36-devel
  3.7 => python37-devel
  ...

Change-Id: Ib1c7463c9995d543b6db739839b53bb6edb53907

messages:

Needed by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704122/'}, {'account_id': 31533, 'date': '2020-02-05 09:47:19.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

There is little chance for this to be accepted and even less for OVN 2.12 RPM package to be accepted in RDO Stein, so abandoning. Found a different solution that applies in my deployment an fixes the OVN scalability/performance issue - cbasically if one builds OVN packages from the branch 'branch-2.12', it's runtime director structure is not changed there, so it is a matter of only patching containers ovsdb and ovn-controller containers installing these patches during deployment/update, no source level patches are needed."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-28 12:54:44.000000000', 'message': 'ovn-dbs-bundle: Prepare for supporting new OVN version with separarte run dirs

This patch prepares the ground for using the latest OVN. OVN is split from
openvswitch and it has its own code repo. After the split, OVN has its
own run dir (/var/run/ovn), db dir (/etc/ovn/), log dir (/var/logs/ovn)
and datadir - /usr/share/ovn/scripts.

With this patch, it supports running older version (2.11) or new
version (2.12) without any issues. It mounts the host directories accordingly
so that there is no impact when OVN is updated.

(cherry-picked from master commit - 0a7bf3a07cd63e979389587bb1b8985dcf8a3842)
Change-Id: I5d778cbeb2863ec0fe649799863752e8eb16492f
'}]
commit_message:
ovn-dbs-bundle: Prepare for supporting new OVN version with separarte run dirs

This patch prepares the ground for using the latest OVN. OVN is split from
openvswitch and it has its own code repo. After the split, OVN has its
own run dir (/var/run/ovn), db dir (/etc/ovn/), log dir (/var/logs/ovn)
and datadir - /usr/share/ovn/scripts.

With this patch, it supports running older version (2.11) or new
version (2.12) without any issues. It mounts the host directories accordingly
so that there is no impact when OVN is updated.

(cherry-picked from master commit - 0a7bf3a07cd63e979389587bb1b8985dcf8a3842)
Change-Id: I5d778cbeb2863ec0fe649799863752e8eb16492f

Found a different solution that applies in my deployment an fixes the OVN scalability/performance issue - cbasically if one builds OVN packages from the branch 'branch-2.12', it's runtime director structure is not changed there, so it is a matter of only patching containers ovsdb and ovn-controller containers installing these patches during deployment/update, no source level patches are needed."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-28 12:39:32.000000000', 'message': 'ovn-db standalone: Create ovndbs before starting the OVN ovsdb servers

The kolla commit [1] deleted the extend_start script for ovn-nb-db-server/ovn-sb-db-server
kolla images. This script created the ovn dbs from the schema. After this commit
tripleo CI is broken as the ovn dbs are not present.

To fix this issue, this patch first creates OVN dbs before starting the OVN ovsdb-servers.

[1] -  I31a372d801dace92950cd85b29b308431f78bbdb
Closes-bug: #1852682

commit_message:
ovn-db standalone: Create ovndbs before starting the OVN ovsdb servers

The kolla commit [1] deleted the extend_start script for ovn-nb-db-server/ovn-sb-db-server
kolla images. This script created the ovn dbs from the schema. After this commit
tripleo CI is broken as the ovn dbs are not present.

To fix this issue, this patch first creates OVN dbs before starting the OVN ovsdb-servers.

[1] -  I31a372d801dace92950cd85b29b308431f78bbdb
Closes-bug: #1852682

(cherry-picked from master commit e8ecbecb6a36c1222a5ff4459ceaa6e7e3b9a680)
Change-Id: I9640529455e1d14c98c3b53993a71d77de8d7a25

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-24 09:49:54.000000000', 'message': "ovn standalone: Start OVN ovsdb-servers using the kolla startup script

Prior to this patch, ovsdb-servers are started directly. This doesn't
take care of any ovsdb schema updates. Instead, if we use the
start-nb/sb-db-server.sh (generated by kolla OVN images [1])
it takes care of creating the db file from the schema file if the db
file doesn't exist. It also takes care of updating the db file if schema was
updated. The start-nb/sb-db-server.sh used ovn-ctl script internally.

This patch also prepares the ground for using the latest OVN.
OVN is split from openvswitch and it has its own code repo. After
the split, OVN has its own run dir (/var/run/ovn), db dir (/etc/ovn/),
log dir (/var/logs/ovn) and datadir - /usr/share/ovn/scripts.

With this patch, it supports running older version (2.11) or new
version (2.12) without any issues. It mounts the host directories accordingly
so that there is no impact when OVN is updated and it is transparent.

(cherry-picked from master commit - fa349ee4f4a6dfe8eca2076722bf04fecaeea638)

Closes-bug: #1860528
Depends-on: I31a372d801dace92950cd85b29b308431f78bbdb
Change-Id: I1fbfaf43af17b558497fd2b46fc4278b4703ec74

commit_message:
ovn standalone: Start OVN ovsdb-servers using the kolla startup script

Prior to this patch, ovsdb-servers are started directly. This doesn't
take care of any ovsdb schema updates. Instead, if we use the
start-nb/sb-db-server.sh (generated by kolla OVN images [1])
it takes care of creating the db file from the schema file if the db
file doesn't exist. It also takes care of updating the db file if schema was
updated. The start-nb/sb-db-server.sh used ovn-ctl script internally.

This patch also prepares the ground for using the latest OVN.
OVN is split from openvswitch and it has its own code repo. After
the split, OVN has its own run dir (/var/run/ovn), db dir (/etc/ovn/),
log dir (/var/logs/ovn) and datadir - /usr/share/ovn/scripts.

With this patch, it supports running older version (2.11) or new
version (2.12) without any issues. It mounts the host directories accordingly
so that there is no impact when OVN is updated and it is transparent.

(cherry-picked from master commit - fa349ee4f4a6dfe8eca2076722bf04fecaeea638)

Closes-bug: #1860528
Depends-on: I31a372d801dace92950cd85b29b308431f78bbdb
Depends-on: I9640529455e1d14c98c3b53993a71d77de8d7a25
Depends-on: I5d778cbeb2863ec0fe649799863752e8eb16492f
Change-Id: I1fbfaf43af17b558497fd2b46fc4278b4703ec74

commit_message:
Use ovn-ctl script to start OVN ovsdb-servers

Using the ovn-ctl script to start the OVN ovsdb-server is the better
way. This script is used to start and stop all OVN systemd services.
This script takes care of creating the database from the schema,
updating the database from the schema when the schema version gets
updated.

The present scripts - start_nb_db_server.sh and start_sb_db_server.sh
doesn't take care of schema updates.

With this, we don't need extend_start.sh in ovn-nb-db-server/ovn-sb-db-server
to create the database from the schema.

This patch also deletes kolla_ovn_extend_start from the ovn-base image as it
is not required.

(cherry-picked from master commit - b8c8fa15edcf5336a1121155cdc880a35ccf161f)

Closes-bug: #1860528
Change-Id: I31a372d801dace92950cd85b29b308431f78bbdb

commit_message:
Rename .gz files in logs helper

When artcl_gzip is false log files do not
contains .gz extension, so this patch renames
files based on artcl_gzip.

Change-Id: I0cb122fe7cc4fd64dabb051060cef5d096a68f77

commit_message:
Fix skipping of tests

The plugin defines a 'watcher' option in the '[service_available]' group
but does not respect it, so if the plugin is installed but
[service_available]/watcher=false, the tests will still run unless
blacklisted. This patch corrects the issue by defining the tempest
skip_checks class method.

Change-Id: Iba29ac0d05f56c83b3be4856ae671f9ae2d31486

commit_message:
Dynamically include generate-config tasks

The generate-config tasks which run on the host to generate config data
under /var/lib/config-data, only run at step1.

There are several tasks that used a when statement to only run the
related tasks at step1. This patch moves all the related generate-config
tasks to a separate tasks file, which can then be dynamically included
at step1.

Using a dynamic include results in less tasks being skipped, which can
save several minutes at scale. This results in 4 less tasks that need to
be skipped at steps 2-5, which equates to 16 tasks overall.

Change-Id: Ifdddcb13362e26babedd47e674089fb0e2a37994

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-03 09:38:32.000000000', 'message': 'Remove sleep command when retrieving OVS dp

OVS agent is a single thread module executed on a os-ken AppManager
context. os-ken uses, by default (and no other implementation is
available today [1]), "eventlet" threads. Those threads are scheduled
manually by the code itself; the context switch is done through
yielding. The easiest way to do this is by executing:
  eventlet.sleep()

If the assigned thread is not ready to take the GIL and do not yield
back the executor, other threads will starve and eventually will
timeout.

This patch removes the "sleep" command during the DP retrieval. This
will keep the executor on the current thread and will prevent the
execution timeouts, as seen in the bug related.

[1]https://opendev.org/openstack/os-ken/src/commit/1f751b2d7d385a75d4255934694177d6fd6f012f/os_ken/lib/hub.py

Closes-Bug: #1861269

Change-Id: I19e1af1bda788ed970d30ab251e895f7daa11e39
(cherry picked from commit 740741864adc142b9bb037e92fd563cae124046a)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove sleep command when retrieving OVS dp

OVS agent is a single thread module executed on a os-ken AppManager
context. os-ken uses, by default (and no other implementation is
available today [1]), "eventlet" threads. Those threads are scheduled
manually by the code itself; the context switch is done through
yielding. The easiest way to do this is by executing:
  eventlet.sleep()

If the assigned thread is not ready to take the GIL and do not yield
back the executor, other threads will starve and eventually will
timeout.

This patch removes the "sleep" command during the DP retrieval. This
will keep the executor on the current thread and will prevent the
execution timeouts, as seen in the bug related.

[1]https://opendev.org/openstack/os-ken/src/commit/1f751b2d7d385a75d4255934694177d6fd6f012f/os_ken/lib/hub.py

Closes-Bug: #1861269

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-06 12:30:43.000000000', 'message': 'PowerMax Driver - Volume group delete failure

1. Volume group deletion failed after a group snapshot had been created
on and deleted from it. This fix eliminates the "cannot use the device for
the function because it is a Copy Session source" on cleanup.
2. Fix to update the metadata correctly for a generic group.

Change-Id: I558e9e67e427b40708220046eef953cb09ea4917
Closes-Bug: #1853589
(cherry picked from commit 27a5c58bdd87514a100517fadb345084b4d37da2)
'}]
commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Volume group delete failure

1. Volume group deletion failed after a group snapshot had been created
on and deleted from it. This fix eliminates the "cannot use the device for
the function because it is a Copy Session source" on cleanup.
2. Fix to update the metadata correctly for a generic group.

Change-Id: I558e9e67e427b40708220046eef953cb09ea4917
Closes-Bug: #1853589
(cherry picked from commit 27a5c58bdd87514a100517fadb345084b4d37da2)

commit_message:
Guard the status code checks

Status code is not always returned, and we should check if it is
defined before trying to make decisions from the value.

Change-Id: If70b777948a9c1dee742b6061a525255ec185aee

commit_message:
Remove mention of meetings from docs

Since the OpenStackClient team doesn't meet anymore, I removed
the mention of meetings and added mention of the IRC channel in the
communication section of the docs..

subject: [ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-02-04 19:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-02-04 19:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-02-05 07:05:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-04 19:45:36.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Iadbea735f22cd8456a32f10fda598dc6a2983ec7
'}]
commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Iadbea735f22cd8456a32f10fda598dc6a2983ec7

subject: Drop django-babel from requirement.txt
messages: [{'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-01-27 15:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-01-27 15:19:31.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from drop-django111-support to django-babel-to-enmerkar'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-02-05 07:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nsame changes purposed in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700841/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-27 15:15:05.000000000', 'message': "Drop django-babel from requirement.txt

Horizon switched the babel extractor for Django from django-babel
to enmerkar recently. congress-dashboard requirement.txt needs to
sync the change to fix gate failure. enmerkar, a successor of
django-babel will beinstalled via horizon, so we don't need to
have it in requirements.txt explicitly.

Change-Id: I9a86d4d6946e651fdfcf289721701f1da125b7a8
"}]
commit_message:
Drop django-babel from requirement.txt

Horizon switched the babel extractor for Django from django-babel
to enmerkar recently. congress-dashboard requirement.txt needs to
sync the change to fix gate failure. enmerkar, a successor of
django-babel will beinstalled via horizon, so we don't need to
have it in requirements.txt explicitly.

Change-Id: I9a86d4d6946e651fdfcf289721701f1da125b7a8
